We went to see this film after seeing a hilarious preview for it (kudos to the people who edited the preview together...they should get an award for the terrific job of making an unfunny film look hilarious).After about only five minutes we realized the film's humor was falling flat. We stuck it out only to discover the rest of the film was also flat. The jokes were not clever, and the comedic performances felt amateur(especially Linsey Lohan). I felt that a big missing park of this movie was the soundtrack. Music adds a lot to "scary" movies and the much of the time in this spoof there was none...and when there was music it was not appropriate to the action on the screen.This movie makes it to the top of my list of most pathetic movies in the last five years!

reviews.review_title: Not on par with the others but still funny
reviews.content: Weaker entry to the franchise but still quite funny in some parts. Got some interesting cameos. Fine to pass the time during the pandemic. Don't forget the popcorn.

It's movies like these that make me wonder why normal people can't just put together a story and make a movie. Because honestly, this was one of the worst movies I've ever seen. The "Scary Movie" franchise should've stopped after the first one. I didn't mind the second or third films but this one was by far the worst.A lot of big names are in the movie, mainly Ashley Tisdale who is the main character and I can't believe she read this script and thought "Wow, this is a great idea" but hey, she probably made good money. This spoof mixes "Mama", "Paranormal Activity", "Rise of the Planet of the Apes", "Black Swan" and every single horror film with a cabin in the woods, which is quite a bit. And there is one scene where it makes fun of that exact thing which was probably the funniest scene in the film. And that scene was in the first 5 minute.The jokes are horrible and way too over the top. I really don't remember much else because I was too bored to care.

The poisonous humor of the Scary Movie spin-offs has seeped into the Scary Movie franchise and destroyed it from within. Epic Movie and Disaster Movie are the worst of the spin-offs and this one is pushing the limits of being grouped in the same category. I found Scary Movie 1 and 2 hilarious. Scary Movie 3 and 4 were also funny. When I heard about this I had hopes and doubts. Unfortunately it turned out like the bad spin-offs. Date Movie was OK... This one was not. I prefer A Haunted House over this one.I hoped that the days of the Scary Movies were not over. But after 4 years now it seems more likely that this fifth movie killed the Scary Movie franchise.Still it's not as bad as Epic Movie and Disaster Movie. I think. It's hard to compare bad movies. And I don't really have the need. I did however, have the need to share my distinction between Scary Movie 1-4 and 5. Bottom line is: IT'S NOT THE SAME AS THE OTHERS! And it most likely spelled the end of the franchise. Which is sad and disappointing. Even though we will always have the memorable and hilarious quadrilogy before this one. The other movies had some lame sections which were survivable. But this whole movie is a lame section. I'm putting all my hopes in the new "A Haunted House" franchise. May it live long and prosper.

I did used to like the Scary Movie films in a rather immature way, now only the first film is the one I can say good things about, because as they go on the sequels get worse and worse, and the spin off films from the same makers, e.g. Epic Movie, Meet the Spartans, Disaster Movie and Vampires Suck are abysmal, this was the fifth film in the now pointless continuing horror films, television and popularised celebrity news spoof series. This film predominantly parodies the "found footage", psychological and science-fiction horror and thriller films, specifically the Paranormal Activity series, Black Swan, Mama and Rise of the Planet of the Apes, as well as spoofing or referencing The Cabin in the Woods, Inception, Evil Dead, Fifty Shades of Grey, The Help, Insidious, Sinister, The Day the Earth Stood Still, 127 Hours and The Hunger Games. Basically the film opens with Charlie Sheen and Lindsay Lohan surrounded by many cameras in the bedroom to make a sex tape, the footage is sped to show them doing all sorts, and then an invisible force attacks them, and Lindsay becomes possessed and goes mental on camera, they were both killed, Charlie didn't stop partying, and Lindsay was arrested again, and the three kids he had went missing. Many months later Ja'Marcus (Snoop Dogg) and D'Andre (Mac Miller) are walking in the woods looking for cannabis plants, but what they find is a cabin in the woods, and inside they find the three missing children and turn them in for the reward, they are kept in a child development research until they are deemed well enough to leave. They put in the custody of Charlie's brother Dan Sanders (Simon Rex) and his wife Jody (Ashley Tisdale), but they can only keep them if they agree to stay in a house with cameras filming their every movement, Jody is first reluctant to have the children, but tries to bond. While doing this she also auditions and gets into a ballet academy, and she tries to win the leading part in Swan Lake as the Swan Queen, but the family are being threatened by the invisible paranormal activity, and the children reveal that it is the spirit they were growing up with, a mother figure ghost-like creature called Mama. The couple's Hispanic maid Maria (Lidia Porto) is frightened by the paranormal forces attacking and tries various religious rituals to stop it, and meanwhile Dan is trying to make progress in his experiments to make apes more intelligent at his research facility, and him being stupid he doesn't realise chimpanzee Caesar (Chris 'Critter' Antonucci). After attempting to use the help of psychic Blaine Fulda (Katt Williams) who turns out to be a complete fraud, and dream extractor Dom Kolb (Ben Cornish) who tries inception but only ends up creating a Fifty Shades of Grey scenario with Christian Grey (Jerry O'Connell), Dan and Jody decide to return to the cabin in the woods the children were found in for answers. They find the Book of the Dead, which may be the cause of the haunting events, as it possesses anyone nearby when the words "gort klaatu barada nikto" are read out, turning them into insane zombie like monsters, and Mama finally shows her face threatening the children near a cliff, but she is defeated being pushed off. Jody realises she loves the children more than anything else, and allows now friend Kendra Brooks (Erica Ash) to have the leading part in Swan Lake, which turns out to be a striptease show, and Caesar in the audience warns us watching to enjoy life while we can before the apes take over, there is a quick post credits bit as well where Charlie Sheen and Lindsay Lohan are alive and that the whole film was a dream. Also starring Katrina Bowden as Natalie, Heather Locklear as Barbara Morgan, J.P. Manoux as Pierre, Molly Shannon as Heather Darcy, Kate Walsh as Mal, Mike Tyson and Josh Robert Thompson (More Than Freeman in the adverts) as the Narrator. I knew this going to be terrible, especially as recurring stars Anna Faris and Regina Hall were not returning as Cindy and Brenda, and the fact that stars who have appeared before are playing either mock versions of themselves or different characters is even more stupid. As with the previous three sequels the spoofs are not funny at all, the gross material and repetitive gags, such as head bangs and slip ups, are awful, silly moments like vacuum cleaners having a party and orgy and children acting like wild animals are ridiculous, and overall it just feels like any scripting, acting and general budget on the film has been blown and turn into an atrocious watch, a crap horror spoof. Poor!

reviews.review_title: Some decent spoofs here but not the best or worst spoof made !
reviews.content: I thought this movie would be really bad, I do like some spoof movies, I liked all the other scary movies and I even liked some bad one such as Shirke you know what you did last summer, I didn't Not mind Not Another Teen movie , I thought those were decent movies, also really liked Superhero movie but This scary movie 5 is no were near as bad Disaster Movie (2008), Date Movie or Stan Helsing (2009) or Vampires Suck (2010) Yes is it the weakest of the series not as those bad spoof listed above At the start of the movie, they tried way to hard to be funny, yet could have been funny, I don't think Benny hill music really worked with that scenes. The main spoof this movie focus on is Mama and Black swan and paranormal activity, planet of the apes and there are other spoof as inception and Evil Dead spoof. i Thought Evil Dead spoof was really funny, I laughed Few times in those scenes as for rest of the movie, I did found some scenes funny and other were Jokes goes a little to long and fall flat a number of times. I didn't really like how the movie ended, I didn't find ending that funny at all, Also those fast forward can bit really annoying at time, I there were not that funny at all. I enjoyed it and I laugh a number of times but I did miss Anna, it dose feel a little strange her not being the movie, They were trying to go for a re-boot of series but kinda shot them self in foot with that. Ashley Tisdale was decent but i didn't find her too funny as did the Cindy scenes in all scary movie. They must of cut some scenes out trailer, Some scenes trailer were not in the movie. I really enjoyed 5 out of 10

More like Stupid MoVie; where do we begin? Let's see, a well-known but controversial actor has three children missing who are later found, they're adopted by a married couple and the husband happens to be the actor's brother, unusual and supernatural events relating to someone called 'Mama' begin to occur, then we get a sloppy and unfunny series of skits that land with a thud, referencing films like Paranormal Activity, Inception, The Cabin in the Woods, Rise of the Planet of the Apes, and even Tyler Perry. With cheap gags, crude humor, and painfully unfunny bloopers, the desperate filmmakers throw in pretty much everything but the kitchen sink, yet somehow still managed to leave out all the laughs! There's really no reason for this to exist; the fact that it managed to attract several reputable stars—in any role, no matter how small—is a total mystery. *

I didn't make it far I'd put it at 15 minutes at most but that's being generous. What I saw was one stale reference joke after another rapid fire, pacing was terrible, everything was too fast and it just made it feel like one since the jokes don't even land, it feels like these guys were a one trick pony, a reference isn't a joke. Two, it was rushed.That's all I have to say, it was painful to watch.

This franchise has been getting progressively worse but this one went to unforeseen levels of terrible.The parodies set within this poorly constructed object that can barely be defined as a movie are just lazy. Most of them are clumsily edited into the film's barely coherent story and almost all of them end in a payoff that is usually either a tired pop culture reference that is dated and expired by the time this one hit the theaters, annoying slapstick that disrespects the timeless art, a gag that involves people pointlessly flying through the air thanks to brain-cell destroyingly bad reasons (like drinking a soda too fast or eating Taco Bell for dinner--you know where that one is going) or just culminate in a fart or poop joke. A pre-teen trying to make a parody for YouTube would result in a smarter comedy."Scary Movie V" is awful beyond words. Nothing about it is funny. The acting is awful and, worse yet, the film will actually destroy a person's ability to feel happiness if they ever actually watch it.

reviews.review_title: "Scary Movie 5" is certainly the worst of the series so far and t's time for the franchise to rest, being buried six feet under the ground
reviews.content: This is the bitter end to a series that brought the parody genre to the fore again in the early 2000s and, unfortunately, what we see is a depressing ending, and that is not a word that should be used to define a proposed film. Making you laugh. Gathering a handful of actors without criteria was definitely a bad idea and a lack of commitment to the loyal audience of the series, who valued the old cast. The embarrassment of seeing jokes being made without any effect, or the rescue of commonplaces already overused in the previous four features, is to discourage anyone who has followed the development of the first films. The frustration, among other reasons, is to see a comedy that once was so authorial become silly, with bad seats, jokes out of timing and an excess of nonsense that often does not fit the scene.After David Zucker passed the baton of direction to Malcolm D. Lee, the Scary Movie franchise reached its fifth volume, rivaling in formula and content with the production of Marlon Wayans, Paranormal Inactivity, even coinciding with the parody objects, using the typical first person footage of Paranormal Activity to start your tape. The first news that shocked fans and made us wrinkle our noses was the news that Cindy (Anna Faris) and Brenda (Regina Hall) would not return. How would they manage to make a film in the series without the two main stars? Perhaps the new part of the franchise could be saved by other characters, such as Mahalik (Anthony Anderson), CJ (Kevin Hart) or the president (Leslie Nielsen), but they also don't appear. In fact, "Scary Movie5" does not bring back any character in the franchise, absolutely none. Charlie Sheen and Simon Rex even return, but playing different characters, the first participates in the bad opening scene and the second is one of the protagonists.After a mysterious incident involving a couple, played by Charlie Sheen and Lindsay Lohan, their daughters Kathy (Gracie Whitton) and Lily (Alva Kolker) somehow - equally mysterious, but this time, because of the script - they end up in a cabin in the forest, where they are found by a pair of stereotyped drug addicts experienced by Snoop Dog and Mac Miller. After being rescued, the children are adopted by their father's brother, Dan (Simon Rex), and his wife Jody (Ashley Tisdale). After that, strange things start to happen at the family home.Let's talk more about opening this part. The scene begins with Charlie Sheen and Lindsay Lohan as a couple about to have sex and who are haunted by a ghost. The scene is ridiculous and sloppy from start to finish, with poor performances and an even worse script, full of exaggerations and appeals to make the viewer laugh forcibly, which does not work. Soon after, we have another "opening scene", in which two friends, played by rappers Snoop Dogg and Mac Miller, come across a hut in the middle of the forest and there are two children. The scene is as ridiculous as the first, with stupid dialogues and even worse performances.This fifth part of the series focuses on the story of "Mama", but obviously makes reference to several other films - regardless of the genre - during the narrative, such as "Paranormal Activity", "Evil Dead", "The Conjuring", "The Last Exorcism", "Black Swan", "Inception" and the prelude to "Planet of the Apes". Originally, the feature would be a parody of "Panic 4", just as Inceptional was a parody of the first feature in the horror franchise. However, Wes Craven's film did not achieve the expected commercial success, forcing the parody producers to change their minds. This highlights the fragility of the proposal, which depends directly on the public's prior knowledge of other works to be minimally understood.References to horror films continue, showing Jody's dramas, with repetitive jokes that compare ballet to pole dance. The freak show involving ghosts and demons continues to haunt the existence of the couple, without any condition to make their viewer laugh, making the level of the first four films worse. The tape tries to mix all the aforementioned films looking for an identity, failing to find a minimally acceptable narrative line, since all the elements that add to Jody's drama are completely dispersed from any cohesion or dramaturgical structure. Few of the moments of humor manage to overcome the simple barrier of comedy, not even amusing the public accustomed to torn humorous.Zucker's departure from directing, for him to only write and produce the film, exhibited a considerable decrease in quality, not even having what worked in the rest of Everyone in Panic. The complete absence of positive predicates makes fans more eager for this cinematographic subgenre to ask themselves if the format has any chance of returning to function as entertainment, because even the undemanding viewer this Scary Movie5 is unable to please.Incidentally, the main gags of the film are totally unnecessary for the story's progress, demonstrating the lack of creativity and resourcefulness of the writers. This incompetence can also be seen in the appealing content of some scenes, where the extreme bad taste gets to be offensive, especially in the scene involving Lily and an ice lollipop. Some moments try to emulate the silly humor style of silent films, even using stop-motion in a desperate attempt to offer something that the public has not yet seen in previous films. This is so out of context that they look like bonus scenes during the film itself. When a parody reaches the point of parodying itself - as in certain scenes that refer to the first feature of the franchise -, it is a sign that it has reached rock bottom.The seven intervening years, which took place between the launch of Scary Movie 4 and the production of Scary Movie 5, served to age the type of humor that had been done so far very badly. The audience is different and has aged together. The poorly thought-out sexual scenes are not so pleasing to an audience that in the early 2000s was excited about the bizarre American Pie, and that Scary Movie explored so well. The jokes with the monkeys, the horrible prologue that makes the parody of Paranormal Activity, the first entire act contained of absurdity etc. Takes this film to the bottom of the well. Places that could be used so well here are thrown in the trash.The prologue's metalanguage, of playing with the figures of Lindsay Lohan and Charlie Sheen, does not bring anything new, in fact, it embarrasses the lack of humor in the initial scene, which does not even try to overcome what had already been done. A big problem in this film is the fact that many jokes need to be explained, reaffirmed, many times, by the character who does it. By the way, if humor needs to be explained it is a sign that there is no genuine connection between what is said and the recipient. Already aware of the lack of creativity in the script, many insights are explained within the narrative itself, as in the scene of the newspaper anchor's wife, who needs to reaffirm that she is betraying him - this after the joke has already been made - so that we realize that the scene has a touch of humor. Kind of like making a joke and explaining right away: "Hi, I made a joke, you know?". In fact, narration is used within the film, a resource not previously used, which only highlights the need for this film to seek grace at all costs, even if it explains its own jocularities.With the departure of Anna Faris and Regina Hall, the cast became very weak. Simon Rex has never been one of the strengths of the franchise, but here it is ridiculously bad. The famous non-actors invited to participate, such as Mac Miller, Snoop Dogg and Usher only make things worse and there is more for Ashley Tisdale, the only one with a really good performance in the film. The actress is no Anna Faris, but she manages to perform quite well in the midst of so much mediocrity. Probably "Scary Movie5" will not have a continuation, not only because of the bad reception by the public, but also because it got the worst box office. If that happens, we will miss Cindy, Brenda, Mahalik, CJ and the others.As if that were not enough, added to all of this we have a montage out of rhythm and continuity that further impairs the effectiveness of humor, which no longer works by itself. "Scary Movie5" is certainly the worst of the series so far and one of the worst films ever made in recent years. The sensation of total loss of time invades the thought of those who watch the tape until the end, making the prospect worse by imagining that there may be other numbers like this. The relief almost comes after 74 minutes when the final credits go up after it wasn't possible to have a laugh. Malcolm D. Lee's film suffers from the worst thing that can happen to a comedy film: lack of comic timing. It's time for the franchise to rest, being buried six feet under the ground.

Scary Movie V (Sometimes called Scary Movie, with the V stylized as the roman numeral for five) is the final installment of the Scary Movie series of horror movie parodies, and was released a good seven years after the fourth film. You'd think with that long a wait, the creators would at least try to improve on the humor so it wouldn't rely too much on gross out toilet and sex humor, but sadly, we are mistaken.Starting with Charlie Sheen and Lindsay Lohan trying to do a video (can't say which kind in case IMDb guidelines are against it) in a messed up parody of Paranormal Activity, the story begins with Sheen's children being found by two guys who were fleeing from cannibis growers (played by Snoop Dogg and Mac Miller), they are taken under the care of his brother, Dan Sanders, and his wife, Dina. However, by bringing them to a new home, they also bring home a terrible evil.Basically, the gross humor is back, and it's joined by another kind of humor: child abuse, as some scenes have the children being harmed in what looks like comedic situations (one scene has Aiden, the baby, get his head set on fire, with Dan using a fire extinguisher to put it out, which also launches Kathy, another of the three kids, into something that bumps her head). Also, this film has a lot of disturbing stuff for a film carrying the PG-13 rating, making me wonder how they got away with it. Stay away from this film at all costs.
This isn't a movie. I'm not sure what it is. The writers must have smoked an entire rock of crack thinking this movie was gonna be even remotely appealing.

The previous 4 parts were really great, and Anna Faris shone as a great awesome star. She held this all together. Now, after 7 years, the fifth part came. No Anna Faris, no Regina Hall, and no Wayans Bors. NO Zucker, no humor, no laughter, no wit and no sense. No good script, no real twists, no hilarious spoof, no clever parody, no smart jokes and no real essence. No good play, no great actors, with Tisdale being wooden and wry, then no serious try to make anything valuable. No real effort. In a word, the worst of the worst

This movie was great and I don't know what people are talking about saying it stinks. You should go out and see it if you like comedy. This movie has comedy in mostly every part of it. There is really funny parts in this and I bet you will love this movie. If you saw any of the scary movies you have to see this one. This is one of the best movies there is. It was one of my favorites because there is humor basically throughout the entire movie. There is some excellent jokes in here so again if you like humor go watch this movie. This is not a waste of money or time at all. The movie could be longer but it is a parody so what do you expect it to be. Go watch this movie right away at the next time you can. You wont regret it!

reviews.review_title: You will laugh at least twice..and that's a fact.
reviews.content: I thought all the references all came together quite nicely. However, it is not all that funny. I don't recall even laughing at all during the Lindsey Lohan and Charlie Sheen scenes. It just had nothing to offer. And it went nowhere. There were scenes, however that were funny. i enjoyed Snoop Dogg's short performance. He was actually quite funny. I also thought the Nanny in the Paranormal Activity reference was hilarious.There were plenty of scenes I found funny, but some of them were just so stupid and just so bland that it wasn't funny. I hated the Black Swans references. They just weren't funny at all. It had nothing intelligent to say. It's like a 5 year old just told them what to do.But there are funny scenes in it, just needed so much more. 4/10

reviews.review_title: I like to pretend this one didn't exist
reviews.content: All I'm going to say is.... don't waste your time watching this.

2013 has had a very serious lack of comedy. What we have been sold in the comedy genre has been embarrassingly bad, low-brow humor or indie dramatic comedies where the film's emotional core always over-shadows any potential laughs. They are cute but rarely deliver true laugh-out-loud moments. As we patiently wait in anticipation for the master of comedy, Adam McKay, to have his newest film, Anchorman 2, released in theaters, we find ourselves desperate for a fix of comedy. This is how we end up watching a film like Scary Movie V.The original Scary Movie was a much needed parody of Scream and all the pathetic slasher film rip-offs that followed. While there were some scenes where the film was trying too hard to be funny, the screenplay flawlessly blended together all the slasher flicks that followed Scream and had it's own original twist ending that took bits from all the best films of the 90's. It was the first good parody film since the 80's when Jim Abrahams and Jerry and David Zucker were working together on such classics as The Naked Gun and Airplane! The poster for Scary Movie had the tagline: No mercy. No shame. No sequel. Yet they didn't just make a shameful sequel, they made 3 of them. Even bringing in David Zucker to take over for Keenen Ivory Wayans as director for parts 3 and 4 didn't help. With every entry in the series, the films only got worse. Even as guilty pleasures to watch with friends for mindless entertainment, they stopped working as all the attempts at jokes were only pop-culture references that quickly became out-dated. We didn't think it could get worse than Scary Movie 4 but we were wrong, dead wrong.Scary Movie V or Scary MoVie takes both film parodies and film itself to an unprecedented new low. While it's safe to say this will be the worse movie of 2013, it is an understatement. It is worse than that. It's one of the worse films to have ever been made and makes Grown-Ups 2 seem Oscar-worthy.

Previously this year, Movie 43 tried and failed abruptly to charm the audience. The fifth installment of the beloved/famous series marks the death of spoof comedies. I don;t have the courage to watch other spoof movie in my life.Spoofing heck of a lot of horror movies, it turns out to be a horror to the audience. Cheap dialogs, gross-out sequences, vulgar references all induce repugnance, but humor. The main idea of the Scary Movie franchise is lost in this piece of extremely ridiculous depiction. I laughed countably 2 times and that I don't wanna remember. Supporting cast sucks with the lead ones. If one thing I liked about it is the spoof on Inception. That was funny.Music is average, editing is fine. Awful direction & writing makes this a no-brainer. It has nothing to deliver. I thank the makers they did not instill flesh show. 2.0/10.BOTTOM LINE: Not recommended. The worst film in the series. The worst spoof comedy ever.Can be watched with a typical Indian family? NOProfanity: Strong | Nudity: Mediocre | Sex: Implied | Vulgarity: Mediocre | Violence: Strong | Gore: Mild | Smoking/Alcohol/Drugs: No

reviews.review_title: Another hilarious movie from the Scary Movie team.
reviews.content: Judging from the 3.7 stars grade here on IMDb, people didn't like this movie too much. This surprised me, since my guess would be that most users, especially those that go on the page of this movie, are probably under 30. I guess these people just don't understand or get the humor.3.7 is way too low for this movie.The fifth installment of the Scary Movie series starts of with Charlie Sheen and Lindsay Lohan in bed, spoofing Paranormal Activity. After that, Scary MoVie, just like the previous movies, spoofs other movies. Movies that get spoofed are Mama, Paranormal Activity, The Cabin in the Woods, Black Swan and The Rise of the Apes.After the first scene, we get to follow Mac Miller and Snoop Dogg walking through a forest, looking for a place that grows "the best marijuana". They are gonna go there, and leave. They are later seen running with a huge joint, that both are carrying. They then find a cabin, and a slightly tiresome dialog breaks out between Mac and Snoop, in which Snoop doesn't know what movie Mac is talking about when they are looking at a "Cabin in the Woods". They enter the house, and they find two girls, like in Mama where two little kids are found in a cabin in the woods.Simon Rex and Ashley Tisdale portrays the parent characters of the horror movie Mama in Scary Movie 5. I personally am not a huge fan of Simon Rex's in this movie, as I think his humor and acting is a little bit too immature or whatever.There are also a lot of guest stars in this movie, for example Lindsay Lohan as mentioned before, along with Snoop Dogg, Mac Miller, Usher, Katt Williams, Madea, Lil Duval, Sarah Hyland, Bow Wow and more. They make the movie a lot better, as it gives the movie variation and other positive things.I can't remember the last time I laughed as much as I did during the scene where Sarah Hyland and Bow Wow along with two other actors, gets possessed (or something like that) while they are portraying the characters of the movie "The Cabin in the Woods", obviously in a cabin in the woods. When it all comes down, I think Scary MoVie was one of the best ones so far in the series. If you've enjoyed the previous Scary Movie titles, you will most likely love this one. It gets kind of slow at times, and I personally didn't like the gorilla scenes too much. All the funny scenes made up for that though. There is no 6.5 star grade, but that's what I give it.Thank you for reading!

I had high hopes for this movie, i highly enjoyed 1 & 2, and 3 has its funny moments, with 4 being worth a watch (if only to say you have seen it) This film is without a doubt the worst film i have ever seen in cinema history, it has nothing of the humour in the first couple of films that was expertly provided by the Wayan Brothers, and the main (wo)man herself Anna Faris, who's expert timing and well placed gags literally made the Scary Movie franchise what is was, This film has none of their talents (which is extremely obvious) and has obviously been purchased by some obscure nobody who hoped to capitalise on the successful franchise.... Which FAILED in epic proportions, throughout the entire movie, i laughed a grand total of twice... and not the roll around belly ache laugh, just a minor chuckle... twice. In my opinion this film should be eradicated from history and be re-written ONLY if the Wayan Brothers are on board and ONLY if Anna Faris reprises her role as the hilarious Cindy Cambell.

I feel embarrassed to even give this "movie" 1 star out of 10. This abominable piece of sh*t deserves a flat out ZERO. This "movie" is a collection of pointless and painfully unfunny jokes that have nothing to do with the "storyline". Never can anybody force me to watch this godforsaken disgrace of a "movie" ever again. There is NOTHING redeemable about this "movie". The makers of this "movie" should be ashamed. The only good Scary Movie was the first one. I think the only good thing I can say about this "movie" is that it is so bad, that there may not be a sixth one! But really, this is the worst "movie" I have ever seen in my entire life. I bet the script to this "movie" was written on the cheapest toilet paper ever with a red crayon. The jokes in this "movie" are not funny whatsoever, and it just comes off as immature and unbelievably stupid. Never in my life have I ever seen a "movie" this bad. Seriously, WHO IN THE HELL THOUGHT THIS "MOVIE" WAS A GOOD IDEA?! How in the F**K did this get greenlit? I don't know, and I don't want to know. All i want to say is f**k this "movie". Thank god I saw this for free, so no money was wasted...but unfortunately some of my time was. Why am I even wasting time writing this review? I don't even know...f**k it. 0/10

This movie is the culmination of comedic era headed straight into the dumpster brought on by the Hollywood Cash Grab Machine. This franchise and its subsequent spin offs started strong with the first 2 Scary Movie films, Date Movie, & at the bottom Epic Movie; then everything really went down hill as more and more got pumped out like Meet the Spartans, Vampires Suck, Disaster Movie, Superhero Movie, & the rest to follow in the spoof category. It's a shame really because with proper innovative writing there should have been many better spoof movies to be made with so much content to pull from and make fun of.Now for this movie, it is simply meh. There's a couple of chuckles here and there but mostly you'd have to be 13 and this is the first comedy you've ever seen to enjoy this really. A shame really because it does have quite a few talented comedic actors in it but I think they went to a junior high and asked them to pen the script or the "adult" writers were far too baked at work.
This Series Started Funny And Gradually Ending Up Stupid And Boring. The Best Film Out Of The Series Is Scary Movie 4.

reviews.review_title: The worst film I've seen in a while.
reviews.content: Plain awful. Just awful. Atrocious. In fact worse then atrocious.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as the Wayans brothers' two installments.
reviews.content: 'SCARY MOVIE 5': Two Stars (Out of Five)The fifth installment in the never ending 'SCARY MOVIE' franchise, which began in 2000 with the Wayans brothers at the helm (the eldest, Keenen, directed the original film and his brothers Shawn and Marlon co-wrote and co-starred in it). It was a huge financial hit but was also loathed by most critics and movie fans. The second film was helmed by the same trio of Wayans, performing the same duties, but was much less successful at the box office and even more despised by critics and cinephiles. David Zucker (who co-directed and co-wrote such classic spoof comedy films as 'AIRPLANE!', 'THE NAKED GUN: FROM THE FILES OF POLICE SQUAD!', 'TOP SECRET!' and 'BASEKETBALL') took over directing duties (from Keenen Ivory Wayans) on the third film and Craig Mazin (who also co-wrote the 'HANGOVER' sequels) and Pat Proft (who co-wrote such classic comedies as 'POLICE ACADEMY', 'HOT SHOTS!', 'BACHELOR PARTY' and 'REAL GENIUS') took over writing duties. It was a huge hit and a noticeable improvement over the previous installments. Jim Abrahams (who also co-wrote 'AIRPLANE!', 'TOP SECRET!' and 'HOT SHOTS', as well as another classic 'THE KENTUCKY FRIED MOVIE') also joined the writing team on 'SCARY MOVIE 4'. It wasn't quite as good or successful as '3' but it was still a better film than the first two movies. Now we get 'SCARY MOVIE 5', which was written by Zucker and Proft but directed by Malcolm D. Lee (who's directed such hit comedy films as 'UNDERCOVER BROTHER', 'SOUL MEN' and 'THE BEST MAN'). It's not as bad as the Wayans brothers' two installments but it is a lot worse than the last two movies.Like all the other films in the series it spoofs mostly current hit horror films but it also parodies popular movies in general, as well as pop culture (like the 'Fifty Shades of Grey' novel). This one mainly spoofs the films 'MAMA', 'PARANORMAL ACTIVITY', 'BLACK SWAN', 'RISE OF THE PLANET OF THE APES', 'INCEPTION' and 'EVIL DEAD' (even though the last film was released just a week prior to this movie). The film revolves around Charlie Sheen and his three children going missing. Sheen's kids are then found in the woods, living like wild animals and having been raised by a spirit called 'Mama'. Sheen's brother and brother's girlfriend take the kids in. The movie stars Simon Rex as Sheen's brother (who also appeared in 'SCARY MOVIE 3' and '4', as another character) and Ashley Tisdale as his girlfriend. It features cameos from other stars like Lindsay Lohan, Darrel Hammond, Molly Shannon, Snoop Dog, Heather Locklear and Jerry O'Connell. It's the first film in the series to not feature Anna Faris or Regina Hall. The film is bad, there's hardly a funny joke in the entire movie, but I still found it amusing. Mostly just because I like movies so much (and especially the horror genre) that I just enjoyed all the film references. I agree with all the critics that it's poorly written and just plain stupid but it at least isn't full of over-the-top gross-out humor like the first two movies and it isn't quite as stupid either (in my opinion). The Wayans' films were painfully bad and unfunny (for me). I couldn't stand watching them. This installment was at least amusing (for me) and I liked watching all the stars in it. It's not as good as 'SCARY MOVIE 3' or '4' but some film nuts might get a slight kick out of it (like I did).Watch our movie review show 'MOVIE TALK' at: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6JDL6l-UAwQ

You know, I'm not that kind of guy that hates every parody movie stating it's a "brainless piece of trash". I usually ADORE this kind of film, specially Scary Movie franchise; all the four installments were GREAT to me. However, "Scary Movie 5" is just a BIG deception to me. They had seven years to make a decent film or innovate in the saga, but on the contrary happened; this version doesn't have the hilarious feeling all the others had. It's really such a shame that David Zucker changed so much in his work; "Scary Movie 5" has simply NO plot whatsoever. It's just a bunch of random scenes, most full of bad and old jokes we're tired of watching. The only scene I laughed is when the maid did housework while sleeping. Other than that, it's full of bad acting, specially from Lindsay Lohan and Ashley Tisdale. "A Haunted House" has MUCH more the spirit of "Scary Movie" franchise with better jokes and plot. Watch that instead.

Scary Movie 5 is a giant letdown which is unfortunate. Of all the spoof movies that came out in the past decade, I only enjoyed the Scary Movie franchise. Scary Movie 3 is by far the greatest, and Scary Movie 4 is not that fare behind. But then there is this....honestly, they should have never made this film. What made the first four film successes are gone. This film has some good moments but on the whole, it's not a good or funny movie.Malcolm D. Lee's film directs this spoof that spoofs films like the Rise of the Planet of the Apes, Black Swan, Mama, and so on. It's basically about this girl who believes her house is haunted by this terrifying poltergeist.Is it even safe to talk about the acting? The acting is pretty lame. Ashley Tisdale has the makings of a good actress, but not here. Simon Rex, what on earth happened from the good ol' days of Scary Movie 3? Everyone here made Lindsay Lohan seem like an Oscar-nominated actress.Overall, Scary Movie 5 is very disappointing because it's just a lame duck. All the Scary Movies are stupid and dumb, but in a fun way. In this film, I did lots of grimacing. There were some good moments here, namely the real-life spoofs of Lindsay Lohan and Charlie Sheen. Here's hoping they make no more of these films. I rate this film 4/10.

reviews.review_title: IQ above 0? If so this is not the film for you...
reviews.content: I have been a fan of the scary movie series for a good few years and have seen them all multiple time and had high hopes for this film HOWEVER this was not the case If you, for one, have an IQ above 0, then you will find this film lacklustre, humourless with a severe lack of acting ability The appalling performances will astound you like you've never seen it before. What makes this worse is the appalling excuse of a story line which is next to non existent. Don't get me wrong there were some amusing moments in the film which were well scripted and thought out but as for the rest of the film it appeared to be built around these moments unfortunately dwarfing them.This film was overly disappointing and unfortunately this film does not fit in with the rest of the scary movie films and is a let down to the franchise and does not do the series justice.

I loved the first 3 scary movie films, and the 4th one was kinda OK, but when this one came out I really wanted to see it because I love scary movie in general. But in this film, they took away everything good about it. Where is Cindy? Where is Brenda? And who the hell decided to put Snoop Dog in the film? I mean seriously, he is not an actor, please don't. This film has the worst acting of all time, awful editing, and zero imagination or effort put into it. Sequels tend to usually be worst the the first film but there is a limit. I didn't laughed once, and neither did any of the people in the theater. If you like scary movie please don't see this one or it will ruin it for you.

This is what you get when you get greedy, the original movies by the Waynan bros. SM1 & SM2 were fun, funny and original. SM3 was stolen from the bros and done poorly, here we are at SM5 and it's painfully obvious that it lacks the brilliance of the first two. Scary Movie 5 is a knock- off of a knock-off and even as a parody movie it's just awful. I love silly bad movies, but this is just bad bad, nothing to redeem it at all, for the exception of a few cameos. The laughs are few and far between. They would have done better casting unknown actors instead of filling it with D list actors like Charlie Sheen and Lindsay Lohan. Save your money and your time - check out the first two or go see A haunted house instead.

reviews.review_title: Excellent, they just needed a few more laughs,
reviews.content: The whole "Scary Movie" franchise was in my honest opinion dead until the arrival of number 5 which turned the tables around bringing a new set of characters and one or two returning faces. I don't think people are being very enthusiastic about number 5 as it lacks our favourite characters Brenda and Cindy although they are gone we can be sure that there is still some hope that we will meet them once more in the final instalment of "Scary Movie"While on the subject of the final instalment of the franchise "Scary Movie 6" is rumored to be the whole revival of our classic movies bringing parodies from: The Devil Inside, Insidious, Childs Play, Dark Skies and its hard to forget The Woman In Black.Well we can only hope to see Brenda and Cindy returning to fight evil once again.

reviews.review_title: A Humorless Abomination of Rushed Satire that Falls as Flat as the Poorly Delivered Verbal Jokes
reviews.content: The art of parody has been diminishing from the limelight of the cinematic comedy for decades now and it's no surprise considering the awful abominations that are created in its name, such as the painful experiences in so called comedies like Epic Movie or Date Movie. One of the longest running spoof series is the Scary Movie franchise that has experienced highs and lows depending on the particular film's strengths and weaknesses. Though the franchise switched creative hands around Scary Movie 3 (arguably the best of the series despite stretching the term of best) the series has never really become a gem of comedic minds or inventive witticism perhaps due to the fact that comedy has devolved at a drastic rate in the last decade with partial blame going towards the original Scary Movie. The past three of the series have tried desperately to re-ignite the silliness of the Zucker inspired parodies of yore with the self-referential style of Naked Gun and the overtly ridiculous delivery of Hot Shots with David Zucker himself writing and producing each of the films. Unfortunately it's either the Zuckers are losing their touch or this particular style of comedy is becoming incredibly dated because Scary Movie 5 is a humorless bore that is filled with lazy satires and blatantly uninspired regurgitated gags. This unnecessary fifth installment of a laboriously unfunny comedy series is so devoid of wit and style that any attempt at revitalizing a nostalgic comedic delivery is completely lost. With modernized satires coming from the minds of Edgar Wright (Shaun of the Dead, Hot Fuzz) and Scott Sanders (Black Dynamite) there can't be a dependency on lazy writing, gross out gags, and overt silliness when wit, coordination, and cleverness are needed for good comedy. While it isn't a surprise that director Malcolm D. Lee was helming this unforgivable waste of time it's truly surprising and disappointing that David Zucker—one of the minds behind Kentucky Fried Movie and Airplane—has Scary Movie 4 and 5 tainting his filmography. It shows an immense amount of laziness when the formula Scary Movie hasn't changed in a comedic culture that demands more inspiring risks.Read more: http://wp.me/py8op-xq More reviews: Generationfilm.net

Scary movie 5, as a sequel, was a real disaster, especially, if compared to the really successful 1-4 counterparts. At the very beginning, the Sheen-Lohan sex scene started well till useless details were added which made this scene so monotonous. The other successive scenes which over-employed children made the movie even provocatively and non-amusingly shocking. Lots of scenes appeared to have the aim of stereotyping, to give few examples, the Latino housemaid metonymically indicated that Latinos foolishly and frequently appeal to God to rid them of superstitious-based troubles caused by their own clumsy nature. Blacks (Snoopy Dog) a drug addict outlaw, (Tyson) was even more foolish, the psychic was a dodger, thieve, and con, in addition to the black ballet dancer who couldn't even fit into the romantic art; though she was good in lascivious pole dancing. Scary movie 5 could be the worst movie in history ever.

I am sorry but I just don't understand what was that. I watched the trailer and I thought this was quit bad but I waited so long for new episode, so I just had to see it my own. Ashley is lovely, funny. i give 9/10 for Ashley, Simon, Charlie, Lindsay, and for every actors in this movie.Main plot is OK, i expect more laugh on cabin in the wood, inception but i disappointed. I really wanted to go into that theater last night and come out extremely satisfied and low on oxygen from from all the laughter...I came out extremely disappointed and a little upset from a few things I'll mention in this review...First off, I watched all the other movies in the franchise and really enjoyed them. Along with The Naked Gun and Airplane, this series tops my list for one of the best...comedy wise. So naturally I came in expecting to laugh from the opening scene to the concluding scene and into the famous Scary Movie credits and bloopers. I was met with a few laughs in the opening to just a few laughs throughout the entire movie. I was more grossed-out by the constant usage of sex in this particular Scary Movie, the others had sex no doubt...but not to this degree.I felt as if the actors weren't pressured enough to be witty and humorous. It could be that they just didn't want to try, but I felt with other movies the actors were really making an effort to be funny and witty. In some instances, the actors in this movie looked to be just reciting the line and not giving it any appreciation whatsoever.Certain parts in the movie like the "Black Swan" story had a genuine playful attitude that I could pick up on, and I appreciated that. Only if they rest of the story was like this I wouldn't be writing this review.I feel like people would be a better laugh if we return to the comedy of the classics such as Airplane, The Naked Gun, and even the first 4 movies of this franchise! I found it odd that David Zucker couldn't redo what he had done with the oldies, but I guess he has just lost his touch in the industry.

reviews.review_title: Not Much That Hasn't Already Been Said
reviews.content:
The Scary Movie franchise grew popularity within the starting of the early 2000's decade as a new and fresh comedy/horror spoof films. Since then there have been many mishaps with the franchise, but each film since its original has seem to appear lower than its processor (with some exceptions) due to subjectivity. However Scary Movie 5 appears to be the lowest the film has sunk. We are witnessed to an unfunny and tiresome spoof film where the directors use tiresome and rehashed jokes to fill time. The film does have certain moments but even in those moments the jokes rarely connect. In general the jokes are mainly misses and the film becomes uninteresting towards the final act. Perhaps it is for the best that this was the final nail in the coffin for the Scary Movie franchise.
===
As a rewatch 01/04/19' Scary Movie 5 remains the worst of the franchise. Having watching the previous films upon the week, and having forgotten much about this film, one remained slightly unaware of how this film was.This film is quite short in runtime, ending at about 73 minutes (excluding end credits) with many more misses in laughs than hits. The main parodies included Paranormal Activity, Black Swan and Planet of the Apes, along with the Cabin in the Woods, Inception and a few other major blockbusters (many non horror films).The Inception scene parody was possibly the highlight, along with some of the Ape scenes. There were several cameo appearances but most of them were quite dull. Apart from that, this film was mainly unfunny and reason as to why this was the lowest grossing film of the Scary Movie franchise.

The movie was a huge let down they should have never followed through with this, the jokes are very cringe worthy, not even funny. Deffinetly worst of the series, I miss the original cast when the slap stick comedy was original. Shame.

reviews.review_title: Easily the worst film of entire franchise!!
reviews.content: Scary Movie 5 is a comedy horror film. The film is directed by Malcolm D. Lee. The film is a sequel to Scary Movie 4 and the fifth and final installment in the Scary Movie film series.This is the weakest and the worst film of the entire franchise and apart from some very limited giggles the film faced a severe drought of comic and funny scenes.The plot of the film is as usual is a parody of lots of other films but the execution is not that exciting. The intro scene between Charlie Sheen and Lindsay Lohan sets up the mood very nice and gives a glimpse of another roller coaster ride of fun and humor but apart from that very scene the film struggles to entertain.The acting is average and screenplay of the film is lethargic, climax of the film also doesn't entertains. The worst film of the entire franchise.

I don't mind a really dumb comedy sometimes. But it actually has to be funny. Airplane, that's a stupidly funny movie, and one of the best of all time. As is The Naked Gun Trilogy and the Hot Shots series. Director David Zucker and his team really know how to do stupid right. But not even he and his co-writer Pat Proft can save Scary Movie V.Scary Movie V is a stupefyingly dumb comedy that parodies actual good movies to boost its self esteem. I'm glad Zucker skipped out on directing this thing, but he still wrote this piece of crap, which makes me sad. In fact, the entire movie makes me sad. It makes me sad because it has all of these talented people who have really hit rock bottom, with nowhere else to go. Charlie Sheen, Lindsay Lohan, Ashley Tisdale, Mac Miller, Snoop Dogg (Oops, Snoop "Lion"), Simon Rex, possibly Heather Locklear, and Katt Williams show up to this thing, and it's the saddest movie since Amour.What is this about? Good question. I don't really know. The story is so mashed together you feel as if Zucker and Proft were mainly trying to make as many references as humanly possible. They spoof Mama (the main one), Evil Dead, Paranormal Activity, Black Swan, Inception (?), and Rise of the Planet of the Apes (?).That said, I laughed once or twice, mainly at the Black Swan scenes (excluding the one where a ballerina, who I'm pretty sure is Heather Locklear, gives birth right on stage). But what also doesn't help the movie is the timing. Because Paranormal Activity has already been parodied in A Haunted House, and much better might I add.At the end of the day, Scary Movie V is pointless, unfunny, and incredibly stupid. Gee, I wonder why Anna Faris didn't show up? Probably because this movie is even too dumb for her, and she's Anna Faris! Charlie Sheen isn't winning anymore. He's losing, and pretty roughly might I add. The same goes for everyone involved in this movie.D

I won't write any spoilers because there are no spoilers to this movie. There really isn't any point, and I know that generally all the scary movies are supposed to be stupid (and making fun of scary movies) but at least the other ones contained SOME laughs and the jokes/spoofs were funny. I read the reviews previously posted and I thought to myself "hey, maybe people are just looking into it too much and maybe it isn't THAT bad" but only about 5 minutes in did I already realize just how terrible it was. The acting was horrible, the script was horrible ... Ah, I just wasted an hour of my life on that. I was very disappointed and expected a lot more. I seriously don't recommend anyone watch this because you will be severely disappointed.
This is the worst movie of the 5 Scary movies. It has a horrible plot.
Bad, Just awful, it never should have been made.. it's the worst out of the whole "Scary Movie" franchise.

So many good actors and celebs in it as well, it had potential to rebuild the franchise, but due to a lack of humour it failed.I preferred "a haunted house", wasn't the best out of all the wayans films, but in my opinion no one could ever do better than a wayans film. I am not even gonna waste my time writing how wrong everithing is in this movie, DO NOT WATCH!

I personally think that it went down the Seltzer/Friedberg Route. Too much Cameos and random Pop culture References, not even the Actors could carry the Film. This and Movie 43 were the biggest "Comedy" disappointments of 2013 so far. Even the rushed Reshoots of Evil Dead and others show they went the Garbage Movie route, parodying something based on Trailers. I went in with low expectations, but with a slight hope that it would be along the lines of funny, Considering this is coming from David Zucker(of Airplane! and Top Secret! fame and of course the unforgettable ZAZ team). What disappointed me the most was that these movies show that spoof is a dying genre, back in the days we had amazing spoofs, now we have garbage. I wasted 10 Euros for this s**t (about 8 dollars) so if anyone is reading this please don't waste your hard earned money on this, go watch The World's End instead, it's not a spoof per se but it is very funny.

reviews.review_title: VIEWS ON FILM review of Scary Movie 5
reviews.content: As I entered the theater to view Scary Movie 5, I had a feeling that it would be a lousy movie. I mean, I knew what I was getting into. Truth is, I probably shouldn't have gone. My ten dollars along with the $10 contribution of millions of other moviegoers is the main reason why these films continue to get made. Like I said in my previous review of Scary Movie (2000), these turkeys don't cost a lot to make. This one was probably around $20 million. It ended up making a little more than $60 million worldwide. Which brings me to my next thought, I don't think the people working on them care whether they are bad or not. They know that the misguided audience member will somehow get duped into thinking they're seeing something relevant. But after 80-85 short nutrition free minutes (that's the normal running time), they as an audience, just wasted an amount of life that will never come back. Every second counts you know in the stratosphere that is movie land.Now I liked the first Scary Movie. As I stated in my review of it, I thought it was the first of its kind. Just like Airplane (1980) spoofed airports and flying, this one was an original spoof of horror films. But they really should have stopped after the first one. I remember seeing the last 20 minutes of it and realized that a sequel would not work, should not work, and will not work. Scary Movie 5 makes some big mistakes, humongous I tell you. The first is having it be rated PG-13. That's difficult to pull off because the tone is lazy. Everyone is basically trying to project R rated humor in a PG-13 film. I guess the studios are trying to bring in a younger crowd. This is, in my opinion, is to make money. What a silly way of thinking. The first Scary Movie was a huge box office success. It had the cojones to push the envelope on gross out humor. That's why I recommend it even to this day. Scary Movie 5 is a tired exercise that maybe belts out three and four genuine guffaws, that's it. Then there is the second mistake this film commits which is trying to spoof the Paranormal Activity movies. It would have worked had it been done maybe 4 or 5 years ago when it was a fresh concept in everybody's mind. But just like the Scary Movie franchise, there have been I guess three Paranormal Activity sequels/prequels ever since. And let's face it, those movies have pretty much already spoofed or parodied themselves. Finally, there is the preview of this movie which I saw a couple times before viewing the actual product. Some of the scenes in it were actually kinda funny. Guess what, almost none of them are in the final cut. Are you kidding me, wow what a clever bait and switch.I could go on and on how disposable this film is but I'll refrain. Here's one more tidbit: Charlie Sheen and Lindsay Lohan do a cameo in the first five minutes of Scary Movie 5. It was probably the funniest portion of the movie. I kinda wondered why they weren't the stars and had been asked to carry the weight. But who are we kidding, their movie careers have already been dented enough. I'm starting to wonder if they even wanted to get things back on track. I guess not. Oh a lot of washed up entertainers seem to taint the heck out of this movie. In addition to Sheen and Lohan, we have Snoop Dogg, Heather Locklear, Molly Shannon, Jerry O'Connell, Jasmine Guy (yeah, I couldn't make this up if I tried), and Mike Tyson (he was in the film for 10 seconds, good for him). They must be really desperate to be on screen cause it seems we haven't seen them in a long while.Here's another thing I was wondering though, did the actual Morgan Freeman do the narration for Scary Movie 5 or was someone imitating him. Lord I hope not because if it was actually Freeman, I might have to stop going to movies forever. I might be scarred for life.If you really wanna to check out this abomination, it's your choice. Just stay away from the closing credits. They're outtakes that are much worse than the movie itself. And they feel staged like they were actually scripted. Yeah I payed my ten bucks and sat in the theater. If I had to do it over again, I'd probably just go home and watch dust form. That's quality entertainment compared to this.

I wish I could give it a lower score than 1, I'm being extremely generous with the score I gave it. It didn't even seem like a Scary Movie at all. It was just horrible, I didn't laugh at all. It was worse than those cheap sex and drugs comedy movies that are a dime a dozen. I expected more from it. The mise en scene was completely different than the other Scary Movies. And it lacked the flow typically found in a Scary Movie, the flow was completely off. As a comedian, I was in physical pain while watching this movie. There were so many places during the movie that could have at least been marginally better had they done things slightly differently.
Why those scary movies sequels are so disscasting it got worst

I rarely come onto IMDb to rant about a bad film, i only take the time to write a review if i really enjoyed a certain movie. This however, was dreadful from start to finish. Scary movie 1 and 2 were very funny imo and 3 had a few laughs in it 4 was just about watchable, but this was bad. Its hard to believe how this film was even made and whats more shocking is that the actors actually thought it would be a good idea to be in it.I will point out that i am not a huge fan of horror films so i may not have a great knowledge on some of the movies being parodied. I shouldn't and wouldn't expect a movie like this to be 10/10 as it is just a silly parody movie and i have seen the others in the series. The writing was okay in the previous ones and there were definitely laughs throughout but this one the writing is awful and the movie relies heavily on slapstick humour. I half giggled once i think in the whole movie.I wouldn't bother wasting your time to see this, i even think 'A haunted house' is better than this and that is saying something. It's also consistently funny. Sure, the nature of many of the jokes is that they exist in a vacuum and aren't necessarily related to what's going on or what matters,thought motion-capture animation was beyond the range of foul-mouthed R-rated comedy, here's your evidence to the contrary.There aren't exactly any curveballs in this story, but that's when you realize you're watching a film in which a man is trying to stop hanging out with his profane teddy bear. Despite the obvious outcomes, "Ted" has to be considered an original comedy. this movie was funny i'm glad snoop dog was nit and mac miller they were funny together

This movie was absolutely hilarious, I don't know why everyone is making it out to be sh*t, it isn't, but hey, that's the point of parodies, they're supposed to be stupid. The funniest scene in this movie is the Evil Dead spoof and when Mama falls of the cliff, I also liked the Black Swan sex scene as it was executed well, Maria the housekeeper was the funniest character in this movie for me, Ashley Tisdale was good as Jody, but I would've preferred Anna Faris and Regina Hall, the outtakes and the final scene after the credits really make it worth staying for.All in all I can say Scary Movie 5 is a well executed movie with a lot of laughs and weird moments, go and see it you will not regret it!

This is the single worst movie I've ever seen. The "-movie"movies doesn't exactly have a good track record at this point, but the first Scary movies were actually quite funny. Scary movie 1 actually had me rolling at times, but also had great comedic timing. This movie however, lacks EVERYTHING. I didn't laugh once, ONCE. Not ONE thing made me laugh, no nothing. The scenes that were supposed to build some suspense weren't even laughably bad. The "scary" scenes weren't even close to scary; sped up and the music was so unfitting. Don't get me started on the so-called "acting" in this movie. Don't even consider watching this. Save yourself both the time and frustration of watching this movie. 0/10.

My friends said this movie was good, so when i saw this movie at Best Buy i decided to listen to my friends when they said it was good; one of the worst mistakes I've ever made. This movie was so awful, i don't understand why this one was so bad, i saw 1 and 4, and I loved those. This one was awful, i didn't laugh once, the special effects were bad and the script sucked. In the movie, you could see the mask lines, you could see they were cheaply made, the mama costume was just cheap cloth and the make-up was really bad, and to finish it off: just the whole plot and charters were awful This movie cost me 2 things: 15 bucks, and 1 hour and 15 minutes. Laughs well some, was this The Disaster movie? Different title? After this I wouldn't expect the "Scary Movie" franchise to return from the coffin this film placed the franchise in.

First viewing it felt sick. Vomit. I rated it as zero and switched off early. Except that I had to distrust my first impression and watch it again, see if I switched off early that time too. I found it watch-able but not as interesting as the first or second of the series.I then stayed away from it for a year and then surprised myself by finding it as less vomit worthy than any of the previous in the series.
