It makes me laugh, though.Lindsay was fun, in a parody of herself. Ashley Tisdale as not memorable, as she was in HSM, but I still found her to be fun.

reviews.review_title: Incoherently related skits bemuse and amuse to extremes
reviews.content: There are some serious spoiler alerts issued as this movie is nearly impossible to review without mentioning certain scenes with specificity - now ya know.Things to like/enjoy/be humored by, etc: Snoop Dogg has two scenes of varying interest based upon his stoner rep - he's always been one to poke fun at his own persona - good thing; the Charlie Sheen/Lindsay Lohan opener is merely OK, but there are a couple good lines that save it from pure mediocrity; the possession scene after the invocation (Army of Darkness reference) is over the top; as a husband kisses his maid "m-m-m...You remind me of my father"...remember to pick self off floor following guffaws; death timeline - one of the few truly laugh-out-loud moments; the bonus extended benefactor scene - it all shoulda been kept in this rather short flick.The bad (and some was really, REALLY bad): lesbian scene - ridiculous; possessed vacuums - stupid bad; Heather Locklear dance scene - beyond the pale grotesque; baby and shepherd - really guys?! One knows what to expect from this franchise and this delivers about 1/2 the time, hence the 5 outta 10 rating. If one sets the bar low enough, even uneven drek can be successful. If ya paid $15 to watch this - man, did they see you comin'. If ya rented it from the local library for only the cost of your local tax bill, then hurrah, yer as brilliant as me. Recommended with serious reservations - hide this from prudes and sub-teen kids. For everyone else, laugh and groan, it's all the same for this crew.

The stupidity of movie goers never ceases to amaze me. The fact that this drivel made almost 4 times it's overall budget of 20 million is testament to just how many people are prepared to sit through garbage that tries in vain to pass itself off as comedy.
I caught this last offering on TV one night, so thank God I've never spent a penny on seeing any of these at a cinema, but after 5 movies & 13 years later, I don't think I've ever cracked a smile at any part of this franchise that I've managed to see. The obvious and often infantile humour just seems to be getting worse with each subsequent travesty and yet as long as nonsense like this still manages to rake in a profit, we can almost guarantee a never ending run of sequels. We know they'll never run out of movies to do parodies of, right?
In this installment, we're can see renderings of recent Planet of the Apes, Paranormal Activity. Mama, Cabin in the Woods, Evil Dead and I think there's also a segment to Fifty Shades of Grey. Why they threw that in there is anyone's guess, but then again, why they felt this needed to be made at all is actually more of a mystery.
If you've seen any part of the previous 4 movies then you'll just get more lame and unfunny sight gags, toilet humour, sexual double entendre and hackneyed slapstick, so you may as well throw any and all expectations of getting a laugh, (even a cheap one), out the window
Personally I've never found parody comedies to be funny as it doesn't require any talent when ALL of your source material is somebody else's work. For me, these movies would have been funnier had they only used elements of pop culture, instead of relying on celebrity cameos or a character constantly being confused and eye-rolling in nearly every scene. 
Hopefully the negative reaction to #5 will mean that there won't be a #6 unless they decide to reboot the series, (rebooting seems to be the rage these days) but knowing the way the movie world tends to work, there's enough idiotic fans of this so-called humour to keep it going, regardless if it makes a profit or not, so there's something we can all look forward to.

reviews.review_title: As much as I wanted to like it..
reviews.content: .. I just couldn't. I love this series in general, even the fourth one which for some reason remains my favorite.. Don't ask me why, I'm a clown.This one however felt wrong in every possible way. Yeah it was cool to see the "return" of Charlie Sheen and Snoop's cameo was pretty awesome but it doesn't excuse the rest of the movie. The earlier installments were undeniably cheesy and stupid but that's why I love them. This one was cheesy and stupid for the wrong reasons and I didn't laugh a single time.I finished it even though it felt like torture. Would not recommend you waste your time on this one.

Not as bad as some comments suggest. The first scary movie is obviously the best. I hated the haunted house one, with the butler's grotesque hand. I liked this one (scary movie 5) a lot better. Ashley Tisdale looks so good.

Worst chapter of the saga. Sketches too predictable. Remains the affection to a series that with its bad and good things characterized surely '00s years. Nonsense, American comedy, sexual and horror sketches: funny for a stupid evening with friends, not more.

reviews.review_title: My faith in spoofs is now gone.
reviews.content: So, here we are, many years later after this movie was first hinted not long after Scary Movie 4. I was younger then, so when I saw the fanmade posters featuring Silent Hill, Snakes on a Plane, etc. I thought it was real, but of course, a few years later, I came to my senses. When I first saw this movie was coming out, I wasn't all that excited for it. Which surprised me, I love the franchise, but when I saw Anna wouldn't be returning due to pregnancy, I was disappointed, but I understood why. Now, after just seeing this, I was VERY disappointed. My first complaint, IT WAS ONLY AN HOUR AND 25 MINUTES LONG, LIKE SERIOUSLY. I don't know why it had such a short run time, but I'm sure if they had maybe another half hour, they could have spoofed more movies, perhaps had done more with Sinister, as well as the Evil Dead, perhaps even spoofs on Final Destination, and many more. My second complaint, this movie wasn't all that funny. Okay, maybe there were a few parts, like the opening act with Charlie Sheen and Lindsay Lohan, that was pretty funny, and the Jodi and Kendra sex scene had my crying from laughing so hard. But the MaMa spoof wasn't all that funny, nor was the Rise of The Planet of the Apes spoof. The inception one was good, as well as the Fifty Shades of Grey Parody, but everything else just fell flat. I didn't understand what purpose Simon Rex had in this movie, other than just being there, it's easy to say that his previous role in the franchise as George, was more funny. My third complaint, I honestly think this movie should have been made to secure a rated R rating, I feel as if it had, the movie would have been much more funny. All in all, I think Ashley Tisdale would have done much better, if she was given more to work with, and if the movie was in fact rated R. But in the end, the character Jodi and Kendra stole the movie, which, was obviously meant to happen, and I'm glad it did.My rating: 4/10

reviews.review_title: This was the worst movie I have ever seen in my life.
reviews.content: First of all, I usually love spoof movies that are goofy that everyone else hates. This one is different. Ana Farris was terribly missed. Regina Hall was also noticeably missed. This movie didn't have a single laugh. It was just a spoof of Mama, which I don't even know how they got it made so fast considering Mama just came off the movies. It also spoofed Evil Dead which just started this same weekend. No matter how much you think you might like this movie, or how much you think you would like it anyway, I warn you. You WILL wish you hadn't gone. I guarantee this movie will not be showing in two weeks. It had to be a fairly decent budget because the production values were pretty decent, but I just don't see how this movie ever got approved to be made. The casting was horrible. They should have just waited for Ana Farris to be available. This movie is not even worth renting at Redbox or even watching on cable for free.

reviews.review_title: Oh dear me please make it stop please. ;(
reviews.content: David Zucker (one of the writers of this abomination) was involved in Kentucky Fried Movie Airplane Police Squad and The Naked Gun movies and this is what he is doing now? Charlie Sheen was so unfunny and wooden in those dire Hot Shot movies and he continues to be so here. I don't think in the history of cinema there has been something like this that is so devoid of wit humour or style. Unfunny hammy lame unwatchable cringe inducing muck, avoid at all costs. Without a shadow of a doubt the worst "movie" in cinematic history. David Zucker please please please stop. Why did I go and watch this? I hope in time I will get over the shock of feeling this bad. I sincerely think this is a real sign of the times we live in. I give up.
The absence of Anna Faris was a dead giveaway that this movie was gonna be trash. Awful, unfunny and painful to watch. They should have stopped at 4. You will be more entertained watching paint dry.

People are saying that the movie was bad, WWWHHHAAATT! this film was great! it's not the standard you'd expect to follow Argo to win Best Picture but it's entertaining and it's at least better than some romantic comedy's that have been panned. Also my cinema was filled with teens laughing their heads off so it's our type of humor. The standout stars of the movie for me are Ashley Tisdale & Erica Ash. Other stars who dropped in to make a cameo that were in my good graces were Leonardo DiCaprio, Snoop Dogg & Mac Miller. However the scene between Chalie & Lindsay was OK, however it didn't enjoy it even a hint of Charlie's last appearance in Scary Movie wasn't enjoyable. However the rest of the movie makes up for it. Definitely a fav of mine and will be for many, many years 10/10

reviews.review_title: A complete deception! Please think it twice.
reviews.content: This movie was a complete deception after the beginning scene with Charlie Sheen and Lindsay Lohan there is nothing more to tell.I can not deny that the first couple of Scary Movie were great, and all viewers can see an outstanding effort to tell a good story in order to match some scenes from the criticized movies.Nowadays, the most recent release of this movie is more than disappointing. The main story is too weak, main character seem effortless and some times redundant. I'm still asking my self what was I thinking about it.Please don't waste you time on it.

The principal Achilles heel of Scary Movie 5 is the absence of Anna Faris, that girl and her smile enliven the comedies, Faris is a fantastic actress. Without Faris the saga Scary Movie wouldn't be the same. In this fifth part, the actuation of Ashley Tisdale is detestable, so horrible that this actress deserves a Razzie prize. I agree all the films of the saga are absurd, but this last chapter hasn't good jokes. Just as well I didn't watched this turkey in the cinema. For me is the most disappointing movie of the saga. The best: The cameo of Lindsay Lohan and the movie end. The worst: Nearly all.

It's so bad I just couldn't finish it. it is supposed to be a comedy but during the first 30 minutes of the movie, I didn't laugh even once. People might say that it is because I had no idea what movies it is making fun of, but the fact is that I have to watched all those movies but this movie is just not funny. The story, the lines, the actors, everything. Sigh.

For me, the history of this franchise kind of goes up and down.Scary Movie? Funny crude romp.Scary movie 2? Strike one.Scary Movie 3? Best one of the bunch in my opinion.Scary Movie 4? Strike 2.And now we arrive at Scary Movie 5, which I was hoping would continue the pattern set by its predecessors, but alas, no such luck. The laughs in this flick were very few and far between, normally reserved for its amusing cameo appearances. Simon Rex has his buffoonary dialed in, and other than a brief cameo from familiar face Charlie Sheen, he's the only recurring character present. Leading lady duties were thrown upon Ashley Tisdale, who did an admirable job with her source material. Unfortunately, this sequel left me in the same state Tisdales character found herself in at several points throughout this flick: confused and discontent. While there were a few amusing gags scattered about this flick (the Evil Dead nods were welcome, in addition to the fight on the front lawn) the vast majority of others fall hard enough to cause a concussion. Look at the bright side: if you find yourself concussed, you might not remember watching this thing in the first place.

What a total waste of effort time and money was this piece of crap. I stopped this so called movie after 15 minutes in. I save the stop button for the real stinkers and this one deserves an award in the shape of one. Worst movie ever even cosmopolis lingered longer than 30 minutes on my screen.Not once did we laugh at the terrible stale jokes convoluted by the most wasted talents ever. Really have i ever watched a pile of stinking poo like this.Even The naked gun is watchable compared to it. All people involved should shame their asses of.DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME WATCH OBLIVION INSTEAD WHICH WAS FANTASTIC!!I'm gonna go wash my TV now to cleanse of the stink

I personally believe that after after Scary Movie 2, they started to lose quality and this one unfortunately didn't pick it up. The initial scene with Charlie Sheen and Lindsay Lohan was interesting, but after that it's just a downhill of jokes that are not funny and the timing is completely off. The choice of actors was completely wrong and the acting itself is completely wrong for the most part. The parodies of the movie itself are completely wrong and so apparent, that it takes the whole joy out of watching this. At least the other Scary Movies had that bit of mystery which sort of left you guessing which movie they were making fun of and sometimes it was downright in your face, but here it is just 100% clear what they are doing and sometime don't even bother changing character names or change some of the events (such as Mama, for example) If Anna Faris or any of the other cast members had been involved in this, the movie could have been a bit enjoyable, as it stands, it may mean the end of the franchise.

You know, the Scary Movie franchise might have been stopped being funny after 2, but at the very least 3 & 4 weren't offensively unfunny and had a decent cast (I'm looking at you Seltzerberg.), sadly the same cannot be said for Scary Movie 5. If you've seen any of the trailers, you've pretty much seen the entire movie.The "plot" follows Ashley Tisdale and Simon Rex mimicking scenes from the latest horror flicks the likes of Paranormal Activity, Sinister, Mama, & Evil Dead, & inserting fart jokes. The movie also features a plethora of celebrity cameos from Jerry O'Connell, Terry Crews, Katt Williams, Snoop Dogg, etc. In a painful attempt to squeeze out a laugh from the audience.This probably won't surprise any of you but.....All of Scary Movie 5' s attempts at humor are Needlessly Vulgar, And painfully unfunny and actually mean-spirited. The only time I remember laughing was Molly Shannon' s cameo. The biggest problem with this movie (Aside from the fact that it exists.) Is a problem that Selter/Friedberg movies have...they're out of date by the time they hit the theater.Final Verdict: Skip it!

reviews.review_title: Scary Movie 5 is the ghost of a once-good idea
reviews.content: You want to see something really frightening? If so, with Scary Movie 5, the recent ghastly issue from the horror parody franchise that refuses to die, you've come to the incorrect movie.It's not to be terrified. It's meant to be funny, but you'd find it simpler to read the pulse of a zombie than you'd find a single nice laugh in the film that opened, natch, without any critical previews.

I honestly thought that scary movie 5 could have been somewhat OK, but i was ruined be crappy editing and god awful acting on Simon Rexs' part. One of the things that really annoyed me was the voice editing as it was easy to see where they changed it. The film had some good ideas, like the "Black Swan" and "Evil Dead" but were poorly excited. The only character in the film I actually enjoyed seeing was the Spanish Maid. The rest were unmemorable and a poor choice. Simon Rex ruined this movie. I also loved how at the bottom of the screen (only when it is meant to be shot by video camera), they is the REC or the time, even when they are looking at different angles when there should be no camera there. Main example being when Rex is putting up cameras and he keeps harming himself and we see everything from direction but there are no cameras to be seen. Even when he is supposed to be screwing in a camera in his hand to the wall, we see everything for a cameras point of view from where he is going to put it. Overall, this new addition to the Scary Movie franchise was a letdown due to bad editing, bad writing, bad casting and the evident absence of Anna Faris.

reviews.review_title: horriawful (worse than horrible and worse than awful)
reviews.content: First of all I just want to warn everybody that hasn't watched this abomination yet, just stay away from it (as far as possible). It's the one of the worst things I have ever seen in my life (so far).I had to try it out, although my friends told me not to, because I'm a fan of the scary movie saga. The first one was great, the second was kind of good, the third was hilarious and the fourth was good.There are so many things that don't make sense in this movie. I didn't crack a smile the WHOLE 86 minutes. I'm being dead serious. It's not even funny because I wasted precious time of my life, but that's what happens when they make very bad movie attempts.I still have a few questions on my thoughts though... What happened to the movie parodies they used to do? Did they run out of ideas? Why is it so unoriginal, boring and stupid? What's with all the celebrities that don't fit in? Is this a celebrity hangout or something? Who would want to watch that? Is it time to end the scary movie saga here?If anybody is kind enough to answer my questions I would really appreciate it..I'm telling you right now I would have more fun watching a rhino taking a dump. I didn't think it was this bad but I was wrong. If you are curious to see how bad it sucks just do yourself a favor and buy some candy or do something else with your money and time.Before I end this I just want to say it is not worth the time nor the money so don't even try! You have been warned!

reviews.review_title: It's not worth your time so don't even bother
reviews.content:
It's the early 2000s parody formula but "butchered" in 2013. All you need is to base the story on few recent and successful high budget movies, make fun of everything and everyone in the most ridiculous ways, have action/horror which mostly leads to comedy which in this case leads to very bad comedy, sexy girls and everything else you would expect from a parody.It took them 7 years to finally release another Scary movie. My expectations were low but I didn't realize it would be this bad. It has maybe a few funny moments but the rest of it for me was just painful to watch. I managed to watch it all despite that. I tried to watch it as open-minded I as I possibly could but overall the movie feels like it trying too hard and usually doesn't achieve the goal it pursues. I liked the original few movies of the franchise. They are not good but not too terrible. They are kinda alright and even watchable after all these years but this wasn't and feels like the Scary movie magic is gone.Overall I think a lot of people will not enjoy it and a small portion will. Personally, after watching the original movie this feels like the worst parody I have ever seen so it's a 2 out of 10 and only because I liked one scene otherwise it would be a 1/10
I wouldn't recommend this to anyone familiar or not with parodies at all.

reviews.review_title: Scary MoVie? Boring, Unfunny Crappy MoVie is more like it....
reviews.content: If there was a 0 rating out there, I'd go for it, this is nothing like the other movies in the series, I don't even think a resurrected Leslie Nelsen would have been able to make it watchable.The people who wrote this, took away the assumption that the audience has a brain, and therefore able to process jokes. They seemed to have this pressing need to explain, or overly set up every joke, so it's just unfunny by the end..The opening: Having sheets jump up and down in fast forward with Benny Hill music, clowns and animals underneath is just not funny. It's playing on 1970's cliché sexual humor, in a really, really bad "Missing the point of the original joke" way. There was absolutely nothing about the opening sequence that was funny in any way shape or form. Especially having Charlie Sheen fly through the air and hitting the camera, it wasn't really done in a comical way.The Middle bit: Complete and utter crap. It's like the people who made this doesn't get what's funny, they simply lack any form of humor.Old Jokes, I'd say 60% have been done in previous Scary Movie Films, but in a funny context, this just ain't funny.In stead of this crap, if you are a fan of Scary Movie, go see "A Haunted House - 2013" a Horror Spoof movie made by the maker of Scary Movie 1, Keenen Ivory Wayans.

I loved the previous scary movies, especially 1 and 3. This one however, not only did it not take all the elements of the humor from the previous ones- the clever spoofs, the witty jokes, the plot twists- but it ruined them.They did not put any thought at all at how they will direct the story, they just threw together movies like the paranormal activity, black swan, the evil dead, but they did not make any parody of them in any clever way, they just made references to them.The movie is plot-less in a bad way, boring and practically no moments of laugh. Not recommended.

I read some reviews before watching this and I was quite skeptical going into this I didn't like the beginning except for Charlie Sheen he was the only thing funny about it and the ending but the middle did have some decent moments except for the part where Kendra pole danced at the ballet studio kind of looked away when I saw that the rest was pretty alright apart from the ending I never saw Mama but the way they spoofed it was kinda funny,Paranormal Activity spoof was OK,Inception was a pointless and unnecessary spoof but kind of funny I guess,Evil Dead spoof was pretty funny too in the cabin in the woods also Ashley Tisdale wasn't bad in this either actually quite liked her acting she was pretty believable i liked how they spoofed Black Swan with her only I didn't really think spoofing that was necessary either plus the Rise of The Planet of The Apes spoof was pretty funny too I didn't like that Caesar was narrating the whole movie though that was kind of stupid but I liked the scene where he was shoved into the back of a van with his ape friend and told him that Dan played by Simon Rex he was Jody's husband who was of course played by Ashley Tisdale that they had a mad demon in their house then the other ape misunderstood thinking he said Matt Damon was in their house and that he loved Jason Bourne lol that was hilarious all in all quite a decent movie except for the beginning and ending I give it a 5/10 I won't recommend it though let people decide for themselves if they want to watch it or not.

reviews.review_title: WAS OK, but c'mon, SHARK ATTACK?!
reviews.content: Fiirst off, Charlie and Lindsay's scene were funny, but not that funny, they should've extended it and gave it a few more hilarious scenes, but no. David Zucker kinda lost his writing skills after a a gap of 7 years between 4 and 5, or is it the other writer's fault? The Paranormal Activity spoof was nice and it being connected to MAMA was great, but how it delivers its comedy was blech... And WHY THE HEL DID THEY INCLUDE RISE OF THE PLANET OF THE APES?! I mean, it's a good movie, but it's not good enough to be a SCARY MOVIE. Adding the Evil Dead into the movie was funny but it's too short, while Black Swan was heavily parodied, including the Lesbian Scenes, Uh, we don't need those, okay? And the climax of the movie, BOY IT REALLY SUCKS, they could've done better, but MAMA FALLING INTO A SHARK INFESTED JACUZZI? SUUUUUCKS. Moving on to the Characters, Ashley Tisdale was good at her part but not enough to make it totally funny, and Also Simon Rex. To sum it all up, Scary MoVie is a comedy that'll only make you wanna watch it if you're a fan of the series. Comedy is 3/10 Storyline is 1/10

Only few of the scenes caused me some grace, I think if it had receded somewhat in quality, with some of the previous films, I think this is pretty poor. Many scenes to me were poorly developed, in my opinion not good, but if you like the series of films Scary Movie, well, watch it and then tell me that you think, because as far as I'm concerned, I did not like.They mixed some scenes from last Horror movies that are in theaters, such as Evil Dead, Mama, and one that has not been lacking in recent parodies films, Paranormal Activity, plus add scenes related to Black Swan.It seems that in many of the scenes, not know what to do, and would do anything, trying this would laugh, and for me it was the opposite, seemed rather silly scenes. The worst movie of Scary Movie. What's more, the worst movie I have seen on parodies.If you ask me, I do not recommend.

reviews.review_title: Wasn't Expecting Much, Worse then I Expected
reviews.content: I've been a big scary movie fan and the last two have really let me down. I knew not to expect much based on Scary Movie 4 but was hoping with the amount of hype and good trailer I could expect more. However, this feel very far from the mark, it wasn't humorous at all, I understand they go over the top, but this just looked like they were trying way to hard to be funny, with material that has been done a thousand times. I've seen better low budget parody movies in the last 6 months, that probably had about an 8th of the budget as this. The actors used were of very low talent, and you know you've done something wrong when you cannot even get the series lead star to come back for the fifth movie. Giving this an honest 1/10 because it was really that bad, extremely poor writing, extremely bad acting and just no scene where I could laugh and I laugh at everything.

this fails on so many levels first the jokes are not funny only 9 percent of the jokes worked its a parody of mama pa which is will get around to reviewing soon and black swan another future plan the movie starts with two people finding a cabin with missing child one of them is played by snooped to a new low a couple takes the kids and they soon find that the kids are acting like animal's and go see help from a doctor also the women gets the lead and a crazy women becomes jealous by the way by parody they mean steal the story then the pa part comes into play as a spirit starts haunting the house turns out she is the mother who wants her kids but the couple keep them and the spirit goes away and the crazy womens hit by a car

Watched this past weekend, and fell asleep not even half way through! Ashley Tisdale really isn't a very good actress at all, and should stick to just TV from now on. The beginning with Charlie Sheen and Lindsey Lohan playing themselves was actually funny. They poked fun at themselves in a good way, but other supporting cast wasn't that good at all.I think after the first 2 they kind of lost their luster. Just kept getting more ridiculous. I get the point,but it relied way to much on physical humor. Simon Rex isn't that horrible of an actor, he just needs some better material. Bottom line is don't waste your time on this crap! I liked the Date Movie parody better.

They keep making scary movies for reasons beyond me. The jokes are bad enough let alone you have to have seen the films they'd parodied to get where they're going. Poor acting/direction compounds the issue.

I loved Scary Movie 3, 4 wasn't too bad but this film is terrible. Its just Paranormal Activity 2 with gags and jokes about poo that are not even funny. The only funny part involved a bottle of coke and some mentos but i only giggled at that. The acting is awful the jokes sound like they were made on the spot. The plot is that a couple and their child move into a new house which is haunted. And that's it nothing else happens. This film is probably one of the worse films i have ever seen. Its not funny and... well its just overall a terrible movie. Please don't pay for this movie, it will just encourage the director to make another one.

Cinema is really taking a nosedive this year. The definition of the word joke is really changing before my eyes. Please let there be someone out there with a defibrillator and bring the parody movie back to life. One of the star in my rating was because of the 2 laughs I got and the other one was that it wasn't like the Jason and Aaron movies.The laugh I got was from Snoop Dogg and Mac Miller. I was surprised that Mac Miller would make me laugh because I can't get into his music. The other laugh I got was when the husband and the maid fought on the front yard.Are you seriously going to parody "Fifty Shades of Grey" when that is not even a movie yet? This movie was already late to the party when they parody "Inception", "Black Swan", "Rise of the Planet of the Apes" and "Madea" You also put Ted in the poster? He is not even in the movie! If he was, it wouldn't even had been clever. It would have been a cheap CGI version of him or a little guy in a god awful Ted costume. I bet that they filmed the parody of "Evil Dead" right before they released it. There was another joke about the pool machine cleaners having a party. That really feel flat. I bet Ashley Tisdale did this because she had no other offers on the table. Ignore this movie.

I read many of the 'hate' reviews, some from the 'prolific or prominent or prophylactic' reviewers. Let's understand something immediately. If anybody begins a review with "Scary Movie #5 had not ONE funny moment in it", that reviewer is lazy at best and at worst, a liar. Then, other reviewers spend better than 2/3rds of its review discussing the plot and why it may be flawed. Then they score it a one.This movie is very funny. This movie is often clever. Tisdale and Rex execute clever stuff beautifully. No doubt in my mind they will live up to good scripts and make bad scripts watchable,,--- No doubt.Do not press the play button with an edgy mood that fosters political correctness and inappropriate expectations, (whatever inappropriate expectations may be) or innovative genius. Expect a funny movie and damn the high brows, and me too if you like.

The first Scary Movie was decent. It didn't deserve a sequel let alone 4! Scary Movie 3 was alright, mainly because they had replaced the foul juvenile Wayans brothers with the writer of Airplane! and The Naked Gun. Getting rid of the scatological crude humor and bringing in the cleverer intelligent laughs worked. But Scary MoVie is just as bad possibly even worse than the sickening antics of Scary Movie 2.Usually in a review I would do a summary of the plot. But the writers of Scary MoVie haven't got time for plots! Ashley Tisdale and Simon Rex adopt some weird kids, movie into a new house and vulgar toilet jokes ensue. The weird kids are obviously meant to be like the weird kids from Mama. (SPOOF NUMBER ONE). And Simon Rex works at an ape training lab, which is meant to be like Rise of the Planet of the Apes. (SPOOF NUMBER TWO). His girlfriend Ashley Tisdale is a ballet dancer who is trying to keep the lead role of The Dying Swan which is meant to be like Black Swan. (SPOOF NUMBER THREE).When their asleep loads of jump scares and loud noises are happening, all while being filmed with surveillance cameras. That's meant to be like the Paranormal Activity franchise. (SPOOF NUMBER FOUR). At the beginning of the movie Snoop Dog and some other guy (who looks like Macklemore but isn't Macklemore) are going through a forest and find an old cabin in the woods, that's meant to be like you guessed it The Cabin In The Woods. (SPOOF NUMBER FIVE). Later on Ashley Tisdale goes to the cabin in the woods and a bunch of teenagers are there. There all praising religion and singing cheerful songs, which is the exact opposite of what they do in The Evil Dead. (SPOOF NUMBER SIX). A Morgan Freeman soundalike is narrating the movie, which is meant to be like all those movies which Morgan Freeman has narrated. (SPOOF NUMBER SEVEN). When Ashley Tisdale starts having messed up dreams she gets a dream specialist to help her out. The dream specialist looks exactly like Leonardo Di Caprio from Inception, they even have the bit where he's explaining everything at a cafe. (SPOOF NUMBER EIGHT). And finally for one reason or another Ashley Tisdale ends up in a bedroom about to bang with Christian Grey. That's meant to be like the book 50 Shades of Grey. (SPOOF NUMBER NINE).So there are 9 different spoofs in an 86 minute movie. That's something like 1 spoof every 8 minutes. When a movie copies a scene or a concept from another movie but adds in some sh*t jokes, it doesn't make a parody it makes a sh*tty mess!To makes matters worse all of the characters in the movie are annoying and deserve to die. I was trying to think of someone who was likable and appeared in Scary MoVie. But they don't exist! Simon Rex's character wasn't too bad at the start, but he got so stupid it was unbearable. This is just another 21st century spoof movie - not funny at all! There hasn't been an above average spoof movie since 1994 when the third Naked Gun movie came out. It seems to be no longer possible!Overall I give Scary MoVie 4/10 for 7 laughs throughout the whole 86 minute movie, mainly because of the mildly amusing narrator.

reviews.review_title: I was expecting something bad but this was actually terrible
reviews.content: The only parts I've actually laughed apart from the first few minutes were actually the parts they show at the end with the deleted footage. And some of the deleted parts were actually better than the ones they chose to put in the movie itself...I was very disappointed. The Scary Movie series should have ended either on the second or third movie. I've found this review online which practically sums up my opinion on this movie: "How bad is it? SCARY MOVIE 5 is so bad that the two best performances in the film come from Charlie Sheen and Lindsay Lohan, and they're both out of the movie within five minutes. I'm not saying they're good in it. They're awful. It just so happens their level of awfulness is slightly above anyone else unfortunate enough to be part of the cast. When you find yourself wishing there was more Lindsay Lohan in a movie, you know it's bad."

I can't even begin to describe how much I despise this movie. They seriously cram in as many pop culture references as possible. Some don't even have to do with scary movies! Scary Movie 5 is an unclever, unoriginal parody of films like The Paranormal Activity series and Black Swan (Black Swan, really guys? Are you that desperate for stretching your movie length?). The ONLY thing that I sort of liked in this movie was the stop-motion they used to parody Paranormal Activity, but still every single joke they crammed in there that actually worked they constantly repeated, ruining the joke altogether. It truly is scary what parody movies have become nowadays.

Why does this movie exist? It was this question that was spinning in my head throughout the entire viewing of the film-I apologize for calling IT a movie, nevertheless. To begin with, I like the "Scary Movie" franchise. I really think that the first four parts are a very inventive banter on the American cinema of its time. But, I got the impression that this time the screenwriters decided to make banter on the "Scary Movie" by removing humor and meaning from there. What's worth watching this movie for (not worth it)

The Scary Movie franchise has been around a bit and slowly slipped down hill in quality.But that doesn't mean this isn't one of most fun movies currently out, it has some genuine laugh out loud moments that aren't sexual or crude; sure not many but a few at least.Taking parts from Inception, The Cabin in the woods, The Curse, The Evil Dead and blending them together is pretty hard but Scary MoVie does pull it off and whilst it's probably not going to win many awards it does exactly what it promises, a silly rather fun parody movie that continues some gross out humour.

I mean it. I just couldn't stand more than 40 minutes, no laughing at all, the more that I got was some "heh.." twice, that's it. The movie got me SERIOUSLY depressed and I'm not being sarcastic, I was expecting to see another great movie and all I got was cheap repetitive and predictable jokes over and over, with non sense dialog leading no where. This HAS to be the worst movie Simon Rex has been, and that's sad.. because he can do way way better.2/10, I'll go back to scary movie 3-4 over and over to try and delete this one from my mind.

reviews.review_title: An absolute waste of money, time and popcorn.
reviews.content: Against my own will, I was brought to watch Scary Movie by my friends, expecting to watch a movie that was so awful, I would find good jest amongst it. However, this was not entirely the case. Scary Movie 5 showed a lack of intelligence, that was seen in the first two, and meant for a great lack of enjoyment for the whole film with unfunny and unoriginal jokes that have been poorly used many times before. At times the movie is actually quite repulsing and disturbing with a humor that only the hardest of snuff fans would understand.The humor in other parts of the film were at times worthy of a chuckle or a smile, but not the whole hearted roaring laughter that the first scary movie scavenged from me. I would not recommend this title to anyone who likes to spend their money on enjoyable movies and popcorn that isn't tossed towards the screen in a violent flurry.However, one aspect worth merit from me was the portrayal of Lindsay Lohan and Charlie Sheen in the opening scenes as they were captured perfectly and did very well playing *themselves.*

Just to get this out of the way: This is not a good movie.There, Now that we have that established we can move on.Scary Movie 5 is about on par for the rest of the series in that is has some quite hilarious scenes and a lot of others that just aren't funny and drag on until you start to look for something sharp in the room to end your suffering. This is pretty much the way all of the 'Scary Movies' have gone. Flashes of brilliance amid a lot of unfunny filler. The highest praise I can offer this one is that since they use none of the original characters (but a few familiar faces in the cast) they could release it without crediting Jason Friedberg or Aaron Seltzer anywhere on it. If you liked the previous 4 movies then you will probably like this one as well.

This movie is no way near as bad as people make it out to be. What do you expect from this? Good character development? A plot? The other films don't have any of these either yet people love to give crap to this one. Maybe because it has a different cast? I grew up with the original actors but I don't mind the new casting. Big deal. Boo hoo. Maybe people don't like this one because of the humor? I guess that depends on your preferred type of humor and mood. Don't expect these movies to be spectacular, just see them for what they are, parodies. And for what they are, I think that they're great.

reviews.review_title: I seriously expected it to be better and less infantile
reviews.content: I used to love the Scary Movie films, but this one really made me regret that. The whole changes in the cast and the really low budget shots made the film really bad. The jokes are infantile and seem to have been written by a 13 year old. I give it a 2 because that's how many times I almost laughed at their jokes. This is supposed to be a funny film, but I found the jokes really dirty and immature. Scary Movie's jokes used to be mature and funny. Maybe that's just me, maybe I grew up for those jokes, but I bet if I watch the first one I'll laugh my pants off. I really wonder what came through the producer's minds when they made it. The plot is terrible, everything seems to be sped up, everything happens really fast and unprofessionally. I would not recommend anyone watching it. It was the biggest waste of time of my life. I don't remember watching such a terrible movie in a really long time. But oh well, what could we expect from a series of movies that has been inactive for 7 years. I only expected better quality and good jokes. I didn't get any of those, instead we see plastic babies and 12 year old jokes. I feel sorry for everyone who lost one and a half hour of their lives watching this crap. Cheers.

Is this the worst of the Scary Movie films? Not really, Scary Movie 2 still holds that claim, but this movie just might be the killing blow to the franchise. The main parody here is the film "Mama" which I have never seen, probably never will, and as a result, a vast majority of the movies "jokes" flew over my head. The jokes I did understand weren't even that funny. The Inception spoof was probably the funniest part of the movie, but even that only provided a couple of chuckles. I laughed a few times, which is more then Scary Movie 2 (Zero) but the negative reception this film got, as well as poor box office will probably put this franchise to sleep for good.

reviews.review_title: By far the worst comedy I've ever seen...EVER
reviews.content: Going to see this "film" (Would prefer to use the term garbage) I had semi-high expectations, Yes we all know that the scary-movie brand is all about going over the top and constantly forcing jokes down your throat, but in the previous movies it was rather enjoyable and something you could consider watching on a rainy day.This movie however was all about forcing, it was like listening to a comedian constantly hurling out punchlines with nothing to back it up.It saddens me to say that with this crappy wannabe-movie the entire brand of scary movies has come to an end and I advice everyone who has ever seen a scary movie and thought it was OK to never see this one.It felt like torture in the theater and more than half of the crowd left 30 minutes into the movie because of its incredibly bad humor and timing.This is about as bad of a movie that you can make, really...PS: made this account only to warn others not to go and waste their money to see this garbage, it will make you angry and most likely give you the urge to continuously punch someone in the face in order to get rid of your frustration from all of the bad attempts of making you laugh.bye...

Given the sorry state spoof films were in by the time Friedberg & Seltzer made their directorial debuts with Date Movie in 2006 and the unity in calling this movie dead on arrival, since, due to the fourth film being intended to be the final chapter, neither Anna Faris nor Regina Hall would show up, not even for a cameo, I was prepared to rip Scary Mo-Five-ie a new one. Instead, I thought it was just bland. It's a bad movie that is far less memorable than the quadrilogy but I was never truly shaking my head like with Disaster Movie. The acting's okay, there are some genuinely funny moments and the story at least keeps the focus on horror movies, mainly "Mama" with elements of "Paranormal Activity". Even the references are mostly confined to SCARY movies. And while, it references movies from the past two years, keep in mind the series that started it all did this too but was never attacked as much as later spoof movies because the focus was primarily horror movies. Unfortunately, while not the trainwreck I was expecting it to be, it's still deeply flawed. Ashley Tisdale lacks the same comedic timing as Anna Faris, though I think that's the fault of the material she has to work with, given one notable Disney voice role, making her character be more forgettable. The pointless "Black Swan" subplot doesn't help whereas the dumbass husband's "Rise of the Planet of the Apes" job at least tries to justify its inclusion in the A-story. While the jokes aren't obnoxious, they have the same bad tendency to either last longer than usual or are blatantly telegraphed. And finally, while the production values are better-looking than most of the Seltzerberg films, they still don't feel like they belong to a spoof film in 2013. It actually looks worse than two hard-R gross-out comedies that came out in the early 2000's. I get that horror movies have shoestring budgets, these types of comedies aren't expected to have breathtaking special effects and it was likely intentional given two scenes showing the protagonist and not-Brenda driving to and from their reference to the then-upcoming Evil Dead remake had a very obvious RC car with voiceovers but by 2013, most of us feel that this presentation lends itself better to YouTube videos than to a big-screen experience. So this fifth film that's not-so-secretly a reboot to a comedy classic with slightly-less-entertaining sequels wasn't the cringefest I was expecting but this movie didn't do much to establish that big-screen "[Genre] Movie" parodies were way past their prime. Close but Superhero Movie remains my guilty pleasure of this comedy subgenre.

SCOTT: (Dr. Scott Allison, Professor of Psychology, University of Richmond) Greg, we just saw Scary Movie 5. I m still trying to process all the gags, carnage, and mayhem.

GREG: (Greg Smith, Founder of Agile Writers of Richmond, VA) Scott, this is the fifth in the series and the first not to follow the escapades of recurring characters Cindy Campbell and Brenda Meeks. It was penned by Pat Profit and Airplane! veteran David Zucker. It s a parody of several films including Mama and Black Swan. When you have one of the Zucker brothers involved you can expect an extreme farce. I was mildly disappointed.

SCOTT: The word  disappointed doesnt exactly describe my reaction. But we ll get to that later. Let s run down the plot -- as if it really mattered in a movie like this. We start out with a bizarre bedroom scene involving Charlie Sheen and Lindsay Lohan, who play themselves in this movie. Sheen and Lohan are both haunted by an alien presence, who occupies Lohan s body, forcing her to kill Sheen, whose three children then become missing. Later, Snoop Dogg and a friend discover the children in a Cabin in the Woods -- yet another movie spoofed here. The three kids are then raised by Sheen s brother Dan (Simon Rex) and his wife Jodie (Ashley Tisdale).

GREG: The movie then takes off parodying the heck out of Mama with paranormal activity such as the pool being overrun by automatic pool cleaners and pans falling from the kitchen ceiling. Meanwhile, Jodie is trying to get the lead in the local production of the ballet Black Swan. And that pretty much describes the whole film. From there it s just one set up gag after another.

SCOTT: Greg, I really have mixed feelings about a movie like this. On the one hand, I appreciated the cleverness of the gags throughout. If you liked Airplane!, and you like parodies of scary movies, then this movie might be for you. I found myself chuckling here and there throughout most of the film. But I also found myself looking at my watch several times, hoping the movie would end. It basically works in small chunks, the way that a Saturday Night Live skit does. But 90 minutes was hard to sit through.

GREG: I agree with you whole-heartedly. There were bits that were enjoyable, but usually they were the parts where Molly Shannon or Darrell Hammond from SNL provide cameos. And most of those bits were driven into the ground (like how everyone in the movie had a handi-cam and the Point of View was through the lens of either a handi-cam or security camera). And then there was the Cabin in the Woods scene where Jodie kept reading evil words and the Mormon Bible-thumpers upstairs turned into demons - over and over again. You re right, the bits were fun - once. But 90 minutes of repeating bad gags was too much. This could have easily been a hilarious 30-minute short.

SCOTT: And therein lies the challenge of reviewing a movie like this. Like other gag-fests (e.g., Movie 43), it s unfair to compare it to conventional movies that actually attempt to deliver a coherent story with legitimate characters. Let s face it. The gags here are all that count and everything else serves as just an excuse to show the gags. The filmmakers were clearly going for shock value. Sometimes seeing something shocking is funny, and sometimes it s just plain dumb. Do we really need to see a baby s head set on fire? Is it necessary to show Heather Locklear s birthing fluids gush onto someone s face? Or popsicles and toothbrushes shoved up people s butts? Eww.

GREG: I have to disagree with you, somewhat. I think a good parody will stand up against a traditional movie. When I saw the first Airplane! movie I laughed for a week and went back for seconds. When David Zucker is attached to a film, I expect something special. I expect sharp, smart writing. But, as you say, Scary Movie 5 was just an excuse to see blood spew and body parts detach - much like actual horror movies, in fact. I laughed at a few places, but I can only give it 1 Reel out of 5. As for the heroes, they were absent - a mere shadow of the characters that were being parodied. I give Scary Movie 5 an unprecedented zero Heroes. Movie: Hero: Zero.

SCOTT: A good parody is hard to find these days. For me, the quintessential parody was 1999 s Galaxy Quest, a spoof of Star Trek that is every bit as good, if not better, than every Star Trek movie made. Scary Movie 5 was no Galaxy Quest, and in fact it wasn t even close. Scary Movie s gags were fast and furious, and the cameo appearances of brand-name actors were somewhat amusing. But there wasn t any meat on this bone. And I found myself gagging at the gags. Generously, I give this film 1 Reel out of 5. There were heroes (Dan and Jodie) but they were ridiculous heroes, and intentionally so. Ridiculous heroes get just 1 Hero out of 5. Movie: Hero:

Scary Movie V is like that one friend who will crack a joke, get a couple of laughs, and then repeat it long past the point where it is no longer funny. That being said, and considering the fact that I came off of watching A Haunted House 2 with its prolonged doll sex scene, I have to say I laughed in at least a couple parts.

As a franchise, Scary Movie has essentially stopped becoming a parody, and I say this as a firm believer in the genre. Parody is, at its heart, ingenious in its ability to convey the silliness in an otherwise serious genre. Intelligent parody takes a lot of creativity, just look at the Pythons, the Marx Brothers, Mel Brooks, etc. 

At one point Scary Movie was a film to creatively parody the horror genre, particularly the slasher films of the 80's. Over time the parody went away, and what was left is the modern day equivalent to Ow My Balls! from Idiocracy, literally a series of people getting hit in the crotch. The public hasn't taken it well, given the series is progressively doing worse in the box office.

The big films in Scary Movie V are Mama, Paranormal Activity, Black Swan, and Planet of the Apes, with other references strewn throughout. Dan and Jody adopt the feral children of his deceased brother, Charlie Sheen, while their demonic mother causes terror in their heavily camera-laden house. Jody, meanwhile, wants to become a ballerina.

As a comedy, Scary Movie V is almost scientific in its ability to take the worst jokes and play them on a loop. How many times the Mama character started doing the robot in horror-speed (read: fast forwarding the film 2x), I couldn't tell you. The short jokes are repeated far too much and the long jokes continue way past their expiration date.

If I were to categorize the jokes, the majority would fall on Simon Rex, either him being injured, inadvertently injuring someone else, or being unaware of his own stupidity.

In second place would be the jokes about the family's maid, Maria. Maria is hilarious because she's not only fat and Mexican, she also loves Jesus. Luckily the film constantly reminds us of these points, with Maria either cleaning, very loudly pooping, or doing something related to the cross. And speaking in Mexican.

The best parts of Scary Movie V come from the Black Swan portions, where I will admit I cracked up watching Molly Shannon do ballet moves while constantly balancing a cigarette and a martini. Shannon is the only actress whose performance is consistently solid, which really sets her apart from the rest of the crew.

The bad news is that Scary Movie VI is a given, since while the box office grosses continue to drop, so does the budget, making the film still profitable. The budget for Scary Movie V is reportedly $20 million, just slightly above the first movie back in 2000. If Scary Movie IX has to be filmed on the budget of a McDonald's Happy Meal and only one person goes to see it, you can bet that a sequel will find its way to theaters.

Ashley Tisdale does her absolute best but even she can't save this film from mediocrity. In this fifth instalment, slapstick runs rather dry and many, many gags outstay their welcome. Hits like Inception, Black Swan and Mama are spoofed earning some healthy laughs but many dated cultural references and pop culture gags fall flat, this isn't as bad as the first two Scary Movie films but it's certainly one of the weakest, reaching to the bottom of the barrel in desperation.

Scary MoVie sees young parents Dan and Jody raise their adopted nieces who have a twisted spirit overlooking them. Jody begins to experience paranormal activity in their new home, and soon realises an evil dead demon is stalking them, Jody must now venture to the cabin in the woods to find the book of the dead and stop the deadly curse, whilst Dan focuses on his job at the Ape research facility. The problem here is too many big films are being spoofed, from Inception, Black Swan, Mama, Evil Dead, Paranormal Activity, Insidious, The Cabin In The Woods, even Tyler Perry's Madea and Fifty Shades Of Grey. Writers David Zucker and Pat Proft cram it all in, the film is bursting at its seams with a lot of bad jokes and a feeling of desperation. The scenes where Simon Rex falls over whilst trying to set up the cameras drove me mental as it wasn't funny, the fight between Dan and Rosa, and the repetition of the Cabin in the woods joke fizzled out quicker than you can say boring. The dancing Mama and the Ape's talking about Matt Damon really killed hope, there's so much that falls flat, the Fifty Shades Of Grey scene was pointless and the Inception scene really felt forced. 

However, the whole Black Swan sequences work superbly, the Evil Dead book scene was hilarious and the opening with Charlie Sheen and Lindsay Lohan ripping their personal lives maybe lousy but it works. Erica Ash is superb as Kendra, J.P. Manoux is very funny as Pierre the ballet teacher, and Molly Shannon reels out some big laughs as a broken, alcoholic smoking professional dancer, there are some great jokes here, Ashley Tisdale is great at slapstick and she echoes an Anna Faris in the making, although Faris cannot be beat when it comes to these films. The found footage aspects are decent, especially when exploring their new home, seeing Jody smack the baby into the door frame, setting its head on fire then blasting fire extinguishers reign madness, it's unapologetically poor humour but I chuckled.

Running in at under feature length, Scary Movie 5 feels long and exhausting, it tries to be something big but it really is just a squashed mixed bag labelled as a movie, and Director Malcolm D. Lee does nothing to polish or let alone add craft to this tiresome spoof.

So I really liked the original Scary Movie; enjoyed #3 quite a bit, and was okay with #2 and #4, but this one is definitely the worst of the 5.  The first problem is that the basis of the film is the film: Mama, which was okay at best and definitely didn't deserve this much credit.  There are so many jokes that a few hit and are funny, but most fall flat and are stupid; I actually liked the Inception bit quite a bit.  Overall I'm guessing this will be the last one, which is unfortunate as I've liked most of the Scary Movie films, but if this is what is to be expected I hope they don't make anymore.

A mess of slapped together parodies. They tried to shoehorn too many film references and it just doesn't quite work. If they had just stuck with the Paranormal Activity and Mama story lines, they might have been able to pull off a decent movie. The Black Swan, The Rise Of The Planet Of The Apes, and Fifty Shades Of Grey scenes just didn't flow with the rest of the parodies. I know it's supposed to be dumb, but it can still have a coherent narrative. Instead, this movie gives you a bunch of random parodies and crude jokes duct-taped together to make a crappy comedy.

Most of the jokes seem like they were the first thought that came to the writers. I'll improvise a Scary Movie 5 scene right now off the top of my head: "A guy tries to open a kitchen drawer but it's stuck, so the guy braces his leg against the counter and finally the drawer comes out and hits the guy in the nuts really hard. The guy lays on the floor in agony and finally sits up, only to hit his head on the drawer." This is what a typical scene in Scary Movie 5 is like. It's a bunch of jokes that haven't been thought out.

It does have it's moments, but for the most part Scary Movie 5 comes off as just a half-hearted attempt at humor. If they concentrate more on poking fun at the movies they are parodying and less on the lowest of low brow jokes, they might actually be able to keep this franchise popular. They also need to stick to parodies of movies they've actually SEEN and not just saw the trailer [which is what they did for The Evil Dead remake]. I've seen much worse parody films, but this one still isn't very good.
The series has lost all wit and humor style it use to carry. Now, it's just a brain dead shell shouting jokes with no punch lines.

As I entered the theater to view Scary Movie 5, I had a feeling that it would be a lousy movie. I mean, I knew what I was getting into. Truth is, I probably shouldn't have gone. My ten dollars along with the $10 contribution of millions of other moviegoers is the main reason why these films continue to get made. Like I said in my previous review of Scary Movie (2000), these turkeys don't cost a lot to make. This one was probably around $20 million. It ended up making a little more than $60 million worldwide. Which brings me to my next thought, I don't think the people working on them care whether they are bad or not. They know that the misguided audience member will somehow get duped into thinking they're seeing something relevant. But after 80-85 short nutrition free minutes (that's the normal running time), they as an audience, just wasted an amount of life that will never come back. Every second counts you know in the stratosphere that is movie land. 




Now I liked the first Scary Movie. As I stated in my review of it, I thought it was the first of its kind. Just like Airplane (1980) spoofed airports and flying, this one was an original spoof of horror films. But they really should have stopped after the first one. I remember seeing the last 20 minutes of it and realized that a sequel would not work, should not work, and will not work. Scary Movie 5 makes some big mistakes, humongous I tell you. The first is having it be rated PG-13. That's difficult to pull off because the tone is lazy. Everyone is basically trying to project R rated humor in a PG-13 film. I guess the studios are trying to bring in a younger crowd. This is, in my opinion, is to make money. What a silly way of thinking. The first Scary Movie was a huge box office success. It had the cojones to push the envelope on gross out humor. That's why I recommend it even to this day. Scary Movie 5 is a tired exercise that maybe belts out three and four genuine guffaws, that's it. Then there is the second mistake this film commits which is trying to spoof the Paranormal Activity movies. It would have worked had it been done maybe 4 or 5 years ago when it was a fresh concept in everybody's mind. But just like the Scary Movie franchise, there have been I guess three Paranormal Activity sequels/prequels ever since. And let's face it, those movies have pretty much already spoofed or parodied themselves. Finally, there is the preview of this movie which I saw a couple times before viewing the actual product. Some of the scenes in it were actually kinda funny. Guess what, almost none of them are in the final cut. Are you kidding me, wow what a clever bait and switch.




I could go on and on how disposable this film is but I'll refrain. Here's one more tidbit: Charlie Sheen and Lindsay Lohan do a cameo in the first five minutes of Scary Movie 5. It was probably the funniest portion of the movie. I kinda wondered why they weren't the stars and had been asked to carry the weight. But who are we kidding, their movie careers have already been dented enough. I'm starting to wonder if they even wanted to get things back on track. I guess not. Oh a lot of washed up entertainers seem to taint the heck out of this movie. At least considering the result... This movie is also on the goofier side on many occasions. Sometimes it is hilarious, sometimes just cheap. All in all however this was a fun and entertaining movie - if you pick this one of the shelf to bring home with you you´re most likely a fan of these sorts of movies and are more forgiving (like me when I rate it at 50 %).

The Scary Movie franchise has spawned some stinkers in recent years so for this to be the weakest of the lot is quite an accomplishment. Devoid of laughs, this does the thing that most spoofs seem to fall back on these days which is to simply reenact bits of four or five films from the past few years but forgetting to do it in a way that is even remotely funny. It's all very lazy, in fact the film itself is shy of 70 minutes! There are about 10 minutes of inane outtakes and deleted scenes which pad it out  the rest of the run time. This is a cynical piece of cinema and the only thing that upsets me more than the fact that by renting this I have just potentially helped to encourage them to make another film is that this was penned by David Zucker and Pat Proft! How exactly do you go from The Naked Gun and Hot Shots to this? In truth they have been involved since Scary Movie 3 so I shouldn't be surprised. That doesn't make me any less disappointed in them.

After a long 7 years, Scary Movie 5 arrives and in short this is hands down one of the worst movies of the year and possibly one of the worst comedies ever made. It is very hard to call this a movie at all due to the sheer fact that nothing in this movie is entertaining. You know the story of the Scary Movie franchise, they take alot of recent horror movies and mash them together to parody them. The first and thrid Scary Movie films were good, 2 was decent, and 4 was pretty bad; however 5 is just the lowest of the low in this franchise. The "story", if you can call it that, is the same as Mama and they just allude to other films that came out this year such as Evil Dead, A Haunted House, and Paranormal Activity. The fact that this movie tried to spoof 2 films that came out this year literally a couple months before the release of this film is just astonishing. How can they possibly pull all of this into one movie in such a short amount of time. Then again, that is probably where this movie wen't horribly wrong. You can tell that this movie was rushed through just for the possibility of earning one dollar. The cast in this movie is as low rent as can be with Ashley Tisdale, Charlie Sheen, Snoop Dogg/Lion, Katt Williams, Mike Tyson, Molly Shannon, Heather Locklear, Little Bow Wow, and Lindsay Lohan all wasting their time and giving as little effort as possible. I am really not sure what more I can say about this, It is not funny, not original, and gives parodies a worse name than it had before. David Zucker, the writer and director of Airplane and The Naked Gun, made parody movies great, and to see that he actually wrote this makes parody a truly dead art. Skip this movie, it is not worth any of you time and definitely not your money.

★ (out of four)

The horror genre is always ripe for some parodies.  Earlier in the year we had the dismal "A Haunted House", and now we get another grand misfire.  "Scary Movie V" wastes many opportunities and manages to emerge without hardly a single laugh.

The fifth installment of the no-so-stellar franchise includes lampooning recent films like "Mama", "Paranormal Activity", "Inception", "The Evil Dead", and many others.  They are all loosely tied together with Ashley Tisdale and Simon Rex proudly nailing closed the coffins of their careers.

Even the best section which features a group of clean cut bible posturing teens lead by "Teen Wolf"'s Tyler Posey falls flat.  The worst segment features Lindsay Lohan and Charlie Sheen making stupid comments about their bad career choices while doing a "Paranormal Activity" send up.

Needless to say the film is pretty bad all the way around.  I am often asked why I continue to seek out and see movies that are bad.  I must do it.  Along with the good I gotta see the bad.  Not only do I enjoy seeing great films, but I also enjoy going after the ones that I think are terrible.  I get some strange, twisted enjoyment in that.

Well, critics have gone out to town on this one, but I found myself laughing often enough to consider myself confused. Sure, the film leaves an uneasy feeling of having watched something that is indeed bad - but it did make me laugh out loud several times. Something's got to give! Principally, it's Mama getting spoofed here, with elements of Paranormal Activity, Black Swan, and Rise of the Planet of the Apes all getting absurdly mashed up together. Amusing introductory segment features Charlie Sheen and Lindsay Lohan knowingly making fun of their recent antics. Molly Shannon in a secondary role is terrific; meanwhile Ben Cornish is Leonardo DiCaprio's dead ringer, and of course gets to do the almost obligatory "Inception" scene.

At times fascinatingly bad. With films like 'Disaster Movie' you could feel the filmmakers telling the audience to go fuck themselves, but with 'Scary Movie 5' you question if director Malcolm Lee is actually making a movie he thinks is funny, which seems worse. Jokes go unfinished, or get gags randomly added to the endings of the punchlines, like Lee is convinced it's the extra kick the joke needs like a horrifying hack filmmaker Emeril. I could almost recommend parts of it just for the sake of it's strangeness, as you put your chin on your fists and letting befuddlement crease your brow, gazing perplexed as you wonder the Many Questions of the competent thinker. Did anyone get fired after this? How did it pass test screenings? Were the actors as embarrassed as they look and sound? Who is Ashley Tisdale? Every year I feel more and more removed from cinema as an art form, this year being particularly brutal, not even counting this. But watching 'Scary Movie 5' I never reached anger like I did in 'Star Trek: Into Darkness', mostly because there weren't the stakes there were with 'Darkness', but also because you just end up feeling weak and confused in the face of the time and money (visibly little admittedly) that went into something so strange, alien, and humiliating.
Not even did I laugh once in the whole entire movie.
That sucked. REALLY SUCKED AND REALLY BAD.

Look, I can appreciate a good mocking of a movie.  Scary movies are rife with mockable attributes, but this series needs to die a horror film death.  If the other spoof movies (see - or don't see - also, 'Epic Movie', 'Superhero Movie', or 'Vampires Suck') weren't bad enough, when the series finally returned to the genre that started it all, it brought back the total lackluster attributes that derailed the spoof franchise altogether.  Mocking the 'Paranormal Activity' movies and 'Mama' was the primary goal here, but somehow, they managed to throw in 'Black Swan', 'Inception', and 'Rise of the Planet of the Apes' too.  While all those movies have mockable scenarios, none were effectively ridiculed.  Plus, with no real talent leading this thing - Ashley Tisdale (A Bug's Life) and Simon Rex (Superhero Movie) bear the brunt of the cringe-worthy scenes - it was left to Charlie Sheen ("Two and a Half Men"), Molly Shannon (Hotel Transylvania), Darrell Hammond (Epic Movie), Terry Crews (The Expendables 2), and Snoop Dogg to mumble their way through corny dialogue and general awfulness.  It's no real surprise that Lindsay Lohan (Mean Girls) landed in this thing though. She'll probably do anything at this point for a paycheck.  It's a bad attempt, a la 'Scream 4', to resurrect something that once had merit, only to be more disappointing than the end of 'Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull'.

Unbearably awful, Scary Movie V is a steaming pile of shit. However, none of the parodies are done very well and the production value is atrociously bad.  And the acting (if it can be called that) is terrible at best.  Scary Movie V isn't so much a movie as a bunch of garbage thrown onto a screen.

A collection of references is not a movie. Films like "Airplane" and "The Naked Gun" worked because the sight gags and absurdist humor were meshed into an original story that, on the surface, spoofed a popular genre, with the occasional pointed reference. Those pointed references aren't enough to build a solid film on. Plain and simple.

This is not a movie.

(1 1/2 Stars) Scary Movie V is so weak. I know a lot of you already hate the series, but it was actually funny when it lampooned HORROR movies. This is why spoofs nowadays suck; instead of making fun of a genre, they try to make fun of everything and the jokes fail... horribly. Why Scary Movie V lampoons Rise of the Planet of the Apes, Inception, and Black Swan is beyond me (in fact, there's also a reference to The Help... why is this movie stuck in 2011?). There are jokes about Madea, stupid reality show wives, and Honey Boo Boo and they are embarrassing and unfunny. 

Before I completely trash it, there are some okay jokes that parody Mama, Paranormal Activity, and the Evil Dead remake... notice that these are all HORROR movies; just stick to what's ridiculous in the genre and you'll have a halfway decent movie. Scary Movie V is just sad. I guess it had to take a turn for the worse someday.

I have been quite an avid fan of the Scary Movie series, merely because they offer some pretty hilarious parodies of popular culture and famous films, usually of the horror genre. When I heard that they were releasing Scary Movie 5, I was pretty excited until I checked the trailer. Brenda and Cindy are not the protagonists anymore, despite the fact that Charlie Sheen and Dan returned to star in it. When I learned about that, I opted not to go to the cinema to watch the movie. Well, while I do not regret not going to the theatre to catch it, it is still a passable entry to the series, I'd say. 

The story's main storyline parodies those of 2013's Mama and the Paranormal Activity franchise, with elements from popular films like Black Swan, Sinister, Inception, Fifty Shades of Grey, Evil Dead and Rise of the Planet of the Apes. Dan's nieces and nephew are found in a cabin in the woods (The Cabin in the Woods reference) and he and his wife, Jody, (played by Ashley Tisdale) are to take care of them, only to learn that they are haunted by an apparition named 'Mama'. The entire film is narrated by a faux Morgan Freeman voice, which is pretty impressive and convincing. The story soon develops into a slightly-above-average climax, ending quite positively, though hinting possibilities that the human race will soon fall and the apes shall take over (Rise of the Planet of the Apes). 

On the main aspects, surprisingly, the acting is, while pretty wooden in places, pretty good for a comedy. It makes the film all the more better that way. To have Lindsay Lohan parody herself is simply amazing, I have to say. I absolutely love her for that. Charlie Sheen, too. Those two put together do make a sizzling and wildly hilarious copulation in the beginning (despite the fact that the scene, inspired by the fast-forward bedroom scene from Paranormal Activity, has been over-parodied before). While Ashley Tisdale and Erica Ash as Jody Sanders and Kendra Brooks (replacing Cindy and Brenda, respectively) are what I would say quite passable Scary Movie protagonists, they still cannot surpass Cindy and Brenda. Screenplay, clumsy, but it's a comedy, so probably intentional. 

Technical aspects, nothing out of the ordinary, although I have to say set pieces are quite impressive. Visual effects are pretty minimum, and mostly resemble those used in modern B movies. The cinematography is not too bad. It really captures the very dark and film noir look - somewhat like Inception. 

Overall, not the best entry in the series but passable, I'd say. Sufficiently hilarious, mind-bogglingly random and greatly entertaining.

Yet another lame parody movie.  These things are usually completely random, but this one stays relatively grounded, using the plotline of Mama as the main backbone of the story.  It's no secret that I've never been an advocate for these spoof movies that don't try, and while this is nowhere near as offensive as those Jason Friedberg/Aaron Seltzer collaborations, that can hardly be taken as a recommendation.  Apparently, there's no limit to how many of these movies we can get per calendar year, as we just got A Haunted House a few months beforehand, and we are due to get The Starving Games in November.  In a word, this is lazy, or at least as lazy as you would expect it to be; it's referential for the sake of being referential, and the comedy consists of constant pratfalls, celebrity cameos and the occasional groin injury.  The thing that is most inappropriate here is not the lowbrow humor, it's the choices they make on what movies to parody; yes, Paranormal Activity and Evil Dead are completely apropos and even expected, but then you have running plot threads from Rise of the Planet of the Apes, Inception, and even Black Swan, which just leads you to question who exactly is writing this, and why are they 2-3 years late to the punch?  All of these spoof movies are practically interchangeable with each other, and Scary MoVie is just more of the same.

Scary Movie 5 is not only the WORST movie in the franchise, it also is an insult to parody movies, and to comedy itself.

 The movie frames itself around Paranormal Activity, a young couple Jody (Ashley Tisdale) and Dan (Simon Rex) bring their newborn son home from the hospital unusual things start happening and they must use home surveillance to discover that they are being hunted be a demon. This is the premise of the story, I don't want to go further into it because really that is about it.

 The movie prides itself on Sheen and Lohan laughing at their own personal lives and how low they have fallen and this is not something to be celebrated, especially in a movie that doesn't do it well. There are some celebrity cameos with Usher, Mike Tyson and Snoop Dogg gracing themselves in this mess.

 Apart from the horrid cameos the movie is parodying films that are too old, Black Swan? What? Who even remembers that now? Seriously? Inception? Talk about outdated material!

I will admit to laughing more at this horror movie spoof than I did at the other 2013 attempt at poking fun of how ridiculous and over-clichéd horror movies have become, Haunted House.  Scary Movie 5 is in NO way a continuation of the previous four entries into the franchise and gone is any reference to the character played by Anna Faris in the originals -- who was a send-up of Neve Campbell's character from the Scream films.  Scary Movie 5 instead heavily mocks the Paranormal Activity films by using both hand-held and recovered footage of a family inspired by the film, Mama -- its other primary source material.  Simon Rex and Ashley Tisdale play a couple -- him an uncle of two and her his alt-rock girlfriend musician -- who take in his brother's two orphaned children who had survived in the wilderness by being looked after by a spooky creature the kids can only see they call Mama.  Yes ... the plot has been completely ripped-off ... and skewered with additional portions of other spoof-worthy films such as Sinister and The Evil Dead.  The moments that actually made me enjoy this movie over HH is its somewhat inspired use of two unlikely films -- the (both) brainy Inception and Black Swan.  Inspired by the dream aspect of Inception and the mindbending attributes of Black Swan, Scary Movie 5 at least gives its viewer a few non-typical laughs.  The very first reference to Black Swan did make me chuckle ... and I don't even remember what it was ... I just thought its inclusion was interesting to say the least.  It is a given that it is overtly juvenile and that has been the purpose of ALL Scary Movies.  It isn't supposed to be taken seriously and it tries to remind other films that they aren't supposed to be either.  This movie will only appeal to those who like "dumb" things and enjoy low-brow comedy and want to laugh.  I wouldn't recommend it unless you can beat my 4 chuckles -- as in you'd need fewer.
